par value $0.0001 per share, at the tender offer price of $9.98 per
share and 9,156,300 outstanding warrants of 57<SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> Street
General Acquisition Corp. at the tender offer price of $1.00 per
warrant.</TD>

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The amount of the filing fee, calculated in accordance with Section
13(e) of the Exchange Act, equals $116.10 per million dollars of the
transaction valuation.</TD>
</TR>

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>SCHEDULE TO</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Tender Offer Statement on Schedule&nbsp;TO (&#147;Schedule&nbsp;TO&#148;) is being filed by 57<SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP>
Street General Acquisition Corp., a Delaware corporation (&#147;57<SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> Street&#148; or the
&#147;Company&#148;), pursuant to Rule&nbsp;13e-4 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the
&#147;Exchange Act&#148;), in connection with the Company&#146;s offer to purchase for cash up to 4,801,544 shares
of its common stock, par value $0.0001 (&#147;Common Stock&#148;) per share (the &#147;shares&#148;), at a price of
$9.98 per share, net to the seller in cash, without interest (the &#147;Stock Purchase Price&#148;) and up to
9,156,300 outstanding warrants to purchase Common Stock (the &#147;warrants&#148;) at the tender offer price
of $1.00 per warrant, net to the seller in cash (the &#147;Warrant Purchase Price&#148;) for an aggregate
purchase price of up to $57,075,709.12. The Company&#146;s offer is being made upon the terms and
subject to certain conditions set forth in the Offer to Purchase
dated February&nbsp;22, 2011 (the
&#147;Offer to Purchase&#148;) and in the related Letters of Transmittal (&#147;Letters of Transmittal&#148;) which, as
amended or supplemented from time to time, together constitute the offer (the &#147;Offer&#148;). This
Schedule&nbsp;TO is intended to satisfy the reporting requirements of Rule&nbsp;13e-4(c)(2) of the Exchange
Act.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All information in the Offer to Purchase and the related Letters of Transmittal, copies of
which are attached to this Schedule&nbsp;TO as Exhibits (a)(1)(A), (a)(1)(B) and (a)(1)(C), is hereby
expressly incorporated by reference in response to all of the items in this Schedule&nbsp;TO, and as
more particularly set forth below.
</DIV>
<!-- link2 "Item&nbsp;1. Summary Term Sheet" -->
<DIV align="left"><A NAME="W81625000"></A></DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Item&nbsp;1. Summary Term Sheet.</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The information set forth in the section of the Offer to Purchase titled &#147;Summary Term Sheet
and Questions and Answers&#148; is incorporated herein by reference.
</DIV>
<!-- link2 "Item&nbsp;2. Subject Company Information" -->
<DIV align="left"><A NAME="W81625001"></A></DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Item&nbsp;2. Subject Company Information.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B><I>(a)&nbsp;Name and Address.</I></B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The name of the issuer is 57<SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> Street General Acquisition Corp., a company
organized under the laws of the State of Delaware, and the address of its principal executive
office is 590 Madison Avenue, 35th Floor, New York, New York 10022. 57<SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> Street&#146;s
telephone number is (212)&nbsp;409-2434.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B><I>(b)&nbsp;Securities.</I></B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
Schedule&nbsp;TO relates to the Company&#146;s shares and warrants.
As of February&nbsp;22, 2011, there
were approximately 6,062,556 shares issued and outstanding (of which 5,456,300 shares were issued
in the Company&#146;s initial public offering, or IPO) and 9,156,300 outstanding warrants to acquire
shares of common stock.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B><I>(c)&nbsp;Trading Market and Price.</I></B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The information set forth in the sections of the Offer to Purchase titled &#147;Information About
the Companies&#148; and &#147;Price Range of Securities and Dividends&#148; is incorporated herein by reference.
</DIV>
<!-- link2 "Item&nbsp;3. Identity and Background of Filing Person" -->
<DIV align="left"><A NAME="W81625002"></A></DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Item&nbsp;3. Identity and Background of Filing Person.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B><I>(a)&nbsp;Name and Address.</I></B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The name of the filing person and subject company is 57<SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> Street General
Acquisition Corp. 57<SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> Street&#146;s business address is 590 Madison Avenue, 35th Floor, New
York, New York 10022. 57<SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP> Street&#146;s telephone number is (212)&nbsp;409-2434.
</DIV>

the following table:
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- link2 "Item&nbsp;4. Terms of the Transaction" -->
<DIV align="left"><A NAME="W81625003"></A></DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Item&nbsp;4. Terms of the Transaction.</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B><I>(a)&nbsp;Material Terms.</I></B>

</DIV>

incorporated herein by reference.

    <TD valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD colspan="3" valign="top" align="left"><B>57</B><B><SUP style="FONT-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">TH</SUP> STREET GENERAL ACQUISITION CORP.</B></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD align="left" valign="top">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-99.A.1.A
<SEQUENCE>2
<FILENAME>w81625exv99waw1wa.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-99.A.1.A
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv99waw1wa</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <IMG src="w81625w8162502.gif" alt="(57th Street Logo)">
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Offer to
    Purchase for Cash<BR>
    by<BR>
    57TH STREET GENERAL ACQUISITION CORP.<BR>
    of<BR>
    Up to 4,801,544&#160;Shares of its issued and outstanding Common
    Stock<BR>
    at a Stock Purchase Price of $9.98 Per Share<BR>
    and<BR>
    All 9,156,300 issued and outstanding Warrants, Each to Purchase
    One Share of its Common Stock<BR>
    at a Warrant Purchase Price of $1.00 Per Warrant</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">THIS
    OFFER AND WITHDRAWAL RIGHTS WILL EXPIRE AT 5:00 P.M., NEW YORK
    CITY TIME, ON TUESDAY, MARCH&#160;22, 2011 UNLESS THE OFFER IS
    EXTENDED.</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">If you
    support our proposed Merger with Crumbs, do <U>not</U> tender
    your Common Shares in this Offer.</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    57th&#160;Street General Acquisition Corp. (&#147;57th
    Street&#148;, the &#147;Company&#148;, &#147;we,&#148;
    &#147;us&#148; or &#147;our&#148;) hereby offers to purchase:
    (i)&#160;up to 4,801,544&#160;shares of its common stock, par
    value $0.0001 per share (the &#147;Common Shares&#148;), at a
    purchase price of $9.98 per share, net to the seller in cash,
    without interest (the &#147;Stock Purchase Price&#148;), for a
    total purchase price of up to $47,919,409 and (ii)&#160;all
    9,156,300 of the outstanding warrants, each to purchase one
    share (the &#147;Warrants&#148; and collectively with the Common
    Shares, the &#147;Securities&#148;), at a purchase price of
    $1.00 per Warrant, net to the seller in cash, without interest
    (the &#147;Warrant Purchase Price&#148;) for a total purchase
    price of up to $9,156,300, each upon the terms and subject to
    certain conditions described in this Offer to Purchase and in
    the respective Letter of Transmittal for the Common Shares and
    the Warrants (which together, with this Offer to Purchase as
    they may be amended or supplemented from time to time,
    constitute the &#147;Offer&#148;). Notwithstanding the
    foregoing, this Offer is conditioned upon, among other things,
    the aggregate consideration payable as Stock Purchase Price and
    Warrant Purchase Price to tendering holders pursuant to this
    Offer not exceeding $9,156,300 (which we refer to as the
    &#147;Cash Condition&#148;) and therefore if Common Shares and
    Warrants representing aggregate consideration exceeding such
    amount are tendered, the Cash Condition will not be satisfied.
    If the Cash Condition is not satisfied or more than 4,801,544
    Common Shares are validly tendered and not properly withdrawn we
    will terminate or extend the Offer. If we terminate the Offer,
    we will be unable to consummate the Merger.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Stock Purchase Price is equal to the per share amount on
    deposit in our trust account as of the commencement of the Offer
    plus interest accrued until two business days prior to the
    consummation of the Merger (as defined below), less taxes
    payable. Each of the Stock Purchase Price and Warrant Purchase
    Price may be collectively referred to herein as the
    &#147;Purchase Price.&#148; See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151;
    Number of Shares and Warrants; Purchase Price; No
    Proration.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    This Offer is being made pursuant to the terms of a Business
    Combination Agreement dated as of January&#160;9, 2011 and
    amended on February&#160;18, 2011 (as amended, from
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">time-to-time,</FONT>
    the &#147;Business Combination Agreement&#148;), by and among
    57th&#160;Street, 57th&#160;Street Merger Sub LLC, a Delaware
    limited liability company and wholly-owned subsidiary of
    57th&#160;Street (&#147;Merger Sub&#148;), Crumbs Holdings, LLC,
    a Delaware limited liability company (&#147;Crumbs&#148;), the
    members of Crumbs (the &#147;Members&#148;) and the
    representatives of the Members and Crumbs pursuant to which,
    subject to the terms and conditions contained therein, Merger
    Sub will be merged with and into Crumbs with Crumbs surviving
    the merger as a non-wholly owned subsidiary of
    57<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">th</SUP>

    Street (the &#147;Merger&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Pursuant to its certificate of incorporation, as amended, and
    the Delaware General Corporation Law, 57th&#160;Street may
    consummate a merger without stockholder approval by providing
    all holders of its Common Shares with the opportunity to redeem
    their Common Shares through a tender offer pursuant to the
    tender
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    offer rules promulgated under the Securities Exchange Act of
    1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;). This Offer is
    being made in part to provide 57th Street stockholders with such
    opportunity to redeem their Common Shares and to allow the
    Merger to be completed without a stockholder vote. See &#147;The
    Offer&#160;&#151; Purpose of the Offer; Certain Effects of the
    Offer.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    THE OFFER IS CONDITIONED ON SATISFACTION OF THE CASH CONDITION,
    THE MERGER CONDITION (AS FURTHER DESCRIBED IN THE OFFER TO
    PURCHASE) AND NO MORE THAN 4,801,544 COMMON SHARES&#160;BEING
    VALIDLY TENDERED AND NOT PROPERLY WITHDRAWN AND CERTAIN OTHER
    CONDITIONS. SEE &#147;THE OFFER&#160;&#151; CONDITIONS OF THE
    OFFER.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Only Securities validly tendered at their respective Purchase
    Price, and not properly withdrawn, will be purchased pursuant to
    the Offer. Securities tendered pursuant to the Offer but not
    purchased in the Offer will be returned at our expense promptly
    following the expiration of the Offer. See &#147;The
    Offer&#160;&#151; Procedures for Tendering Shares and
    Warrants.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We will fund the purchase of Securities in the Offer with our
    cash resources and cash available to us from the
    Trust&#160;Account (as defined in the Offer to Purchase) upon
    consummation of the Merger. See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151;
    Source and Amount of Funds.&#148; <B>The Offer is not
    conditioned on any minimum number of Common Shares or Warrants
    being tendered. The Offer is, however, subject to certain other
    conditions, including a maximum number of Common Shares being
    tendered and the satisfaction of the Merger Condition and the
    Cash Condition. </B>See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Purchase of
    Shares and Warrants and Payment of Purchase Price&#148; and
    &#147;&#151;&#160;Conditions of the Offer.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Common Shares are quoted and traded on the OTC
    Bulletin&#160;Board under the symbol &#147;SQTC.&#148; On
    February&#160;18, 2011, the last reported sale price of the
    Common Shares was $10.03 per share. The Warrants are quoted and
    traded on the OTC Bulletin&#160;Board under the symbol
    &#147;SQTCW.&#148; On February&#160;18, 2011, the last full
    trading day for the Warrants before the announcement of the
    Offer, the last reported sale price of the Warrants was $1.20
    per Warrant. <B>Securityholders are urged to obtain current
    market quotations for the Common Shares and Warrants before
    deciding whether to tender their Securities pursuant to the
    Offer. </B>See &#147;Price Range of Securities.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We also have outstanding units comprised of one Common Share and
    one Warrant to acquire one Common Share. The units also are
    quoted and traded on the OTC Bulletin&#160;Board under the
    symbol &#147;SQTCU&#148;. This Offer is only open for each of
    our Common Shares and Warrants, separately, but not together as
    part of our units. You may tender Common Shares or Warrants that
    are included in units, but to do so you must separate such
    Securities from the units prior to tendering such Securities.
    See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Procedure for Tendering Common
    Shares and Warrants.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <B>Our board of directors has unanimously (i)&#160;approved our
    making the Offer, (ii)&#160;declared the advisability of the
    Merger and approved the Business Combination Agreement and the
    transactions contemplated by the Business Combination Agreement,
    and (iii)&#160;determined that the Merger is in the best
    interests of the stockholders of 57th&#160;Street and if
    consummated would constitute our initial business transaction
    pursuant to our Certificate of Incorporation. If you tender your
    Common Shares in the Offer, you will not be participating in the
    Merger and therefore, our board of directors unanimously
    recommends that you do not accept the Offer with respect to your
    Common Shares.</B> However, neither we, our board of directors,
    Morrow&#160;&#038; Co., LLC, as information agent (the
    &#147;Information Agent&#148;) for the Offer, nor Continental
    Stock Transfer&#160;&#038; Trust&#160;Company, as depositary
    (the &#147;Depositary&#148;) for the Offer is making any
    recommendation to you as to whether to tender or refrain from
    tendering your Warrants pursuant to the Offer. You must make
    your own decision as to whether to tender your Common Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Warrants and, if so, how many Common Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Warrants to tender. In doing so, you should read carefully the
    information in this Offer to Purchase and in the related Letter
    of Transmittal, including the purposes and effects of the Offer.
    See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Purpose of the Offer; Certain
    Effects of the Offer.&#148; You should discuss whether to tender
    your Common Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Warrants with your broker, if any, or other financial advisor.
    See &#147;Risk Factors&#148; for a discussion of risks that you
    should consider before participating in this Offer and the
    Merger.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Each of 57th&#160;Street GAC Holdings LLC, a limited liability
    company wholly owned by our officers, directors and advisors and
    our &#147;Sponsor,&#148; and each of our officers, directors and
    advisors, has agreed not to tender any Common Shares pursuant to
    the Offer, and our Sponsor has agreed to tender all of its
    Warrants
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    pursuant to the Offer. See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Purpose
    of the Offer; Certain Effects of the Offer&#148; and
    &#147;Certain Related Transactions of 57th&#160;Street.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <B>Neither the Securities and Exchange Commission (the
    &#147;SEC&#148;) nor any state securities commission has
    approved or disapproved of these Securities or passed upon the
    accuracy or adequacy of this Offer. Any representation to the
    contrary is a criminal offense.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Questions and requests for assistance regarding the Offer may be
    directed to the Information Agent for the Offer, at the
    telephone numbers and
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">e-mail</FONT>
    address set forth on the back cover of this Offer to Purchase.
    You may request additional copies of the Offer to Purchase, the
    Letter of Transmittal, and the other Offer documents from the
    Information Agent at the telephone numbers and
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">e-mail</FONT>
    address on the back cover of this Offer to Purchase. You may
    also contact your broker, dealer, commercial bank, trust company
    or nominee for copies of these documents.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">IMPORTANT</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    If you desire to tender all or any portion of your Common Shares
    or Warrants, you must do one of the following before the Offer
    expires:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    if your Common Shares or Warrants, as the case may be, are
    registered in the name of a broker, dealer, commercial bank,
    trust company or other nominee, you must contact the nominee and
    have the nominee tender your Common Shares or Warrants, as the
    case may be, for you;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    if you hold certificates for Common Shares or Warrants, as the
    case may be, registered in your own name, you must complete and
    sign the appropriate enclosed Letter of Transmittal (for Common
    Shares or Warrants, respectively) according to its instructions
    and deliver it, together with any required signature guarantees,
    the certificates for your Common Shares or Warrants, as the case
    may be, and any other documents required by the Letter of
    Transmittal, to the Depositary;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    if you are an institution participating in The Depository
    Trust&#160;Company, you must tender your Common Shares or
    Warrants, as the case may be, according to the procedure for
    book-entry transfer described in &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151;
    Procedures for Tendering Common Shares and Warrants&#148; of
    this Offer to Purchase;&#160;or
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    if you are the holder of units comprised of a Warrant and a
    Common Share and wish to tender Common Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Warrants, as the case may be, included in such units, you must
    separate the Common Shares and Warrants from the units prior to
    tendering such Securities pursuant to the Offer. You must
    instruct your broker to do so, or if you hold units registered
    in your own name, you must contact the Depositary directly and
    instruct them to do so. If you fail to cause your Securities to
    be separated in a timely manner before the Offer expires you may
    not be able to validly tender your Common Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Warrants prior to the expiration of this Offer.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <B>To validly tender Common Shares or Warrants, as the case may
    be, pursuant to the Offer, other than Common Shares or Warrants
    registered in the name of a broker, dealer, commercial bank,
    trust company or other nominee, you must properly complete and
    duly execute the applicable Letter of Transmittal.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We are not making the Offer to, and will not accept any tendered
    Common Shares or Warrants, as the case may be, from,
    stockholders or warrantholders in any jurisdiction where it
    would be illegal to do so. However, we may, at our discretion,
    take any actions necessary for us to comply with the applicable
    laws and regulation to make the Offer to stockholders or
    warrantholders in any such jurisdiction.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <B>We have not authorized any person to make any recommendation
    on our behalf as to whether you should tender or refrain from
    tendering your Common Shares or Warrants, as the case may be,
    pursuant to the Offer. You should rely only on the information
    contained in this Offer to Purchase and in the applicable
    related Letter of Transmittal or to which we have referred you.
    We have not authorized anyone to provide you with information or
    to make any representation in connection with the Offer other
    than those contained in this Offer to Purchase or in the
    applicable related Letter of Transmittal. If anyone makes any
    recommendation or gives any information or representation
    regarding the Offer, you must not rely upon that recommendation,
    information or representation as having been authorized by us,
    our board of directors, the Depositary or the Information Agent
    for the Offer. You should not assume that the information
    provided in this Offer is accurate as of any date other than the
    date as of which it is shown, or if no date is otherwise
    indicated, the date of this Offer.</B>
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    i
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->
<DIV style="width: 100%; height: 9in; border-top: 1px solid #000000; padding-top: 12pt; border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 12pt; border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; padding-bottom: 12pt; border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 12pt"><!-- Begin box 1 -->

<A name='W81625101'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">SUMMARY
    TERM SHEET AND QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    This summary term sheet highlights important information
    regarding this Offer to Purchase (as defined below) Common
    Shares and Warrants (each as defined below) and the Merger (as
    defined below). To understand the Offer to Purchase and the
    Merger fully and for a more complete description of the terms of
    the Offer to Purchase (as defined below) and the Merger, you
    should carefully read the entire Offer to Purchase, including
    any Annexes and documents incorporated by reference, and the
    related applicable Letter of Transmittal (for Common Shares or
    Warrants, as the case may be) that constitute the Offer. We have
    included references to the sections of this Offer to Purchase
    where you will find a more complete description of the topics
    addressed in this summary term sheet.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    &#149;&#160;&#160;&#160;Up to 4,801,544&#160;shares of common
    stock, par value $0.0001 per share, of 57th&#160;Street General
    Acquisition Corp (the &#147;Common Shares&#148;). If more than
    4,801,544 Common Shares are validly tendered and not properly
    withdrawn, 57th&#160;Street will not purchase the Common Shares
    tendered on a pro rata basis; and<BR>
    <BR>

    warrants to purchase Common Shares (the &#147;Warrants&#148;).

    the right, in our sole discretion, to increase or decrease the
    Stock Purchase Price pursuant to the Offer to Purchase, subject
    to applicable law, our Certificate of Incorporation, as amended
    (the &#147;Certificate of Incorporation&#148;) and the Business
    Combination Agreement (as defined below).

    Offer&#148; beginning on page&#160;66.

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Who is
    offering to purchase the Securities?</FONT></I></B>

    57th&#160;Street General Acquisition Corp.
    (&#147;57th&#160;Street&#148;, the &#147;Company&#148;,
    &#147;we,&#148; &#147;us&#148; or &#147;our&#148;) is offering
    to purchase the Common Shares and Warrants.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    We are offering to purchase (the &#147;Offer&#148; or the

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<DIV style="width: 100%; height: 9in; border-top: 1px solid #000000; padding-top: 12pt; border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 12pt; border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; padding-bottom: 12pt; border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 12pt"><!-- Begin box 1 -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    However, this Offer is conditioned upon, among other things, the
    aggregate consideration payable as Stock Purchase Price and
    Warrant Purchase Price to tendering holders pursuant to this
    Offer not exceeding $9,156,300 and therefore if Common Shares
    and Warrants representing aggregate consideration exceeding such
    amount are tendered the foregoing condition will not be
    satisfied.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">What
    is the background of 57th Street?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    57th&#160;Street is a blank check company formed on
    October&#160;29, 2009 for the purpose of acquiring an operating
    business or assets, through a merger, capital stock exchange,
    asset acquisition, stock purchase, reorganization, exchangeable
    share transaction or other similar business transaction. 57th
    Street consummated its initial public offer (its
    &#147;IPO&#148;) of 5,456,300&#160;units, each unit consisting
    of one Common Share and one Warrant to purchase one Common Share
    on May&#160;28, 2010. The net proceeds of the IPO, together with
    $1,850,000 from 57th Street&#146;s sale of 3,700,000 Warrants to
    57th Street GAC Holdings LLC, a limited liability company wholly
    owned by its officers, directors and advisors, (our
    &#147;Sponsor&#148;) and the underwriters of the IPO plus
    $600,193 in deferred underwriting commissions and discounts, for
    an aggregate of $54,476,303, were deposited in trust (the
    &#147;Trust&#160;Account&#148;) pending completion by 57th
    Street of an initial business combination. If 57th Street does
    not consummate its initial business combination by
    August&#160;19, 2011, it must liquidate the Trust&#160;Account
    to the holders of the Common Shares issued in its IPO and
    dissolve.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Is
    there a business combination agreement related to the
    Offer</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Yes. On January&#160;9, 2011, 57th Street entered into a
    Business Combination Agreement (as it may be amended from time
    to time, the &#147;Business Combination Agreement&#148;) with
    57th Street Merger Sub LLC, a subsidiary of 57th Street
    (&#147;Merger Sub&#148;), Crumbs Holdings LLC
    (&#147;Crumbs&#148;), the members of Crumbs
    (&#147;Members&#148;) and the representatives of the Members and
    Crumbs, which was subsequently amended on February&#160;18,
    2011, pursuant to which Merger Sub would merge with and into
    Crumbs, with Crumbs surviving as a non-wholly-owned subsidiary
    of 57th&#160;Street (the &#147;Merger&#148;). Pursuant to its
    Certificate of Incorporation and Delaware General Corporation
    Law (&#147;DGCL&#148;), 57th&#160;Street is permitted to
    consummate the Merger without stockholder approval by providing
    all holders of its Common Shares with the opportunity to redeem
    their Common Shares through a tender offer pursuant to the
    tender offer rules promulgated under the Securities Exchange Act
    of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;). See
    &#147;The Business Combination.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Who
    are Crumbs and its Members?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Crumbs is a Delaware limited liability company and the holding
    company that owns and operates businesses operating under the
    trade name &#147;Crumbs Bake Shops&#148;. As of January&#160;10,
    2011, Crumbs operated 34&#160;company stores in six states and
    Washington, DC, including 14 locations in New York City. The
    company also has an expanding
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">e-commerce</FONT>
    division at
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">http://www.crumbs.com</FONT>
    that ships cupcakes nationwide. See &#147;Business Of
    Crumbs&#148; and &#147;Management of Crumbs&#148; for more
    information about Crumbs and its business.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Crumbs is a privately held company owned by its Members: Jason
    and Mia Bauer (its founding Members) Victor Bauer, EHL Holdings
    LLC, a limited liability company owned by Edwin A. Lewis, and
    John Ireland.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">What
    is the Structure of the Merger and the Merger
    Consideration?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Upon completion of the Merger, subject to the terms of the
    Business Combination Agreement, the outstanding securities of
    Crumbs and Merger Sub will be converted as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    At the closing of the Merger (the &#147;Closing&#148;), the
    Members will be collectively entitled to receive the following
    as consideration in exchange for their Old Crumbs Units (as
    defined in the Business Combination Agreement):
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="6%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="92%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    $27,000,000 in cash;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    3,900,000 newly issued Class&#160;B units of Crumbs (the
    &#147;New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units&#148;), which
    shall be exchangeable for 3,900,000 Common Shares (subject to
    certain adjustments related to organic dilution) at the request
    from time to time of any holder of any such New Crumbs
    Class&#160;B
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<DIV style="width: 100%; height: 9in; border-top: 1px solid #000000; padding-top: 12pt; border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 12pt; border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; padding-bottom: 12pt; border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 12pt"><!-- Begin box 1 -->

    New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units and &#147;Related
    Agreements&#160;&#151; The Exchange and Support Agreement]&#148;
    for more information about the Exchange and Support
    Agreement;&#160;and
</TD>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TR>
    <TD width="6%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    390,000&#160;shares of Series&#160;A voting preferred stock of
    57th Street, par value $0.0001 per share (such series, the
    &#147;57th Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock&#148;),
    which shall among other things entitle the holders of such
    shares of 57th Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock the
    right to initially vote 10 votes per share Shares (subject to
    certain adjustments related to organic dilution) in all matters
    for which the Common Shares are entitled to vote and provide the
    holders of such 57th Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred
    Stock, voting as a class, the right to appoint a majority of our
    board of directors during the &#147;Earn-out Period&#148; as
    further described below. Shares of 57th Street Series&#160;A
    Voting Preferred Stock will be proportionately redeemed upon
    exchange of shares of New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable
    Units. See &#147;Description of Securities&#148; for more
    information about the terms of the 57TH Street Series&#160;A
    Voting Preferred Stock
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 6%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The 3,900,000 New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units and
    390,000&#160;shares of 57th Street Series&#160;A Voting
    Preferred Stock (together referred herein as the &#147;Equity
    Consideration&#148;) combined will, subject to certain
    preferential rights, approximate the voting, economic and other
    rights the Members would have, were they to hold 3,900,000
    Common Shares, representing approximately 39.15% of the
    outstanding Common Shares of 57th&#160;Street after giving
    effect to the Merger and the issuance of the Equity
    Consideration and assuming no Contingency Consideration (as
    defined below) is issued, no Common Shares are tendered in the
    Offer, no Warrants are exercised and no securities are issued
    pursuant to the Incentive Plan (as defined in the Business
    Combination Agreement). See &#147;The Business Combination
    Agreement&#160;&#151; Merger Consideration to be Delivered&#148;
    for a further description of the Equity Consideration.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 6%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The consideration payable at Closing shall be subject to
    adjustment based upon the actual adjusted net working capital of
    Crumbs as of the Closing.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The Members will be also entitled to receive the following
    additional consideration in exchange for their Old Crumbs Units
    upon either the achievement of certain financial targets and
    stock price targets during the period beginning after the
    Closing and ending on December&#160;31, 2015 (such period
    referred to as the &#147;Earnout Period&#148;) or upon the
    occurrence of certain acceleration events:
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    <TD align="left">
    Up to 4,400,000 additional New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable
    Units;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD align="left">
    Up to 440,000 additional shares of 57th&#160;Street
    Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock.
</TD>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 6%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The additional 4,400,000 New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable
    Units and 440,000&#160;shares of 57th Street Series&#160;A
    Voting Preferred Stock (together referred herein as the
    &#147;Contingency Consideration&#148;) combined will, subject to
    certain preferential rights, approximate the voting, economic
    and other rights the Members would have, were they to hold
    4,400,000 Common Shares, when aggregated with the Equity
    Consideration, would represent approximately 57.79% of the
    outstanding Common Shares after giving effect to the Merger and
    the issuance of the Equity Consideration and Contingency
    Consideration and assuming no Common Shares are tendered in the
    Offer, no Warrants are exercised and no securities are issued
    pursuant to the Incentive Plan. See &#147;The Business
    Combination Agreement&#160;&#151; Merger Consideration to be
    Delivered&#148; for a further description of the Contingency
    Consideration.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The issued and outstanding membership interests of Merger Sub,
    which are all currently held by 57th Street, will automatically
    be converted into a number of newly issued class A units of
    Crumbs (as the surviving entity of the Merger, and such units
    the &#147;New Crumbs Class A Voting Units&#148;) equal to the
    number of Common Shares issued and outstanding as of the
    Effective Time (as defined in the Business Combination
    Agreement) of the Merger, and 57th Street shall cease to have
    any other rights in and to Merger Sub (and Crumbs as the
    surviving entity of the Merger).
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    See &#147;The Transaction&#148;, &#147;The Business Combination
    Agreement&#148; and &#147;Description of Securities&#148;.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- End box 1 -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    3
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<DIV style="width: 100%; height: 9in; border-top: 1px solid #000000; padding-top: 12pt; border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 12pt; border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; padding-bottom: 12pt; border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 12pt"><!-- Begin box 1 -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The diagram below depicts our organizational structure
    immediately following this Offer and the Transaction.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <IMG src="w81625w8162503.gif" alt="(FLOW CHART)"><B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Are
    the Offer and the Merger conditioned on one
    another?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Yes. Pursuant to the Business Combination Agreement, it is a
    condition to the consummation of the Merger that the Offer is
    conducted in accordance with the terms of the Business
    Combination Agreement and that 57th Street shall have accepted
    the Common Shares and Warrants validly tendered and not properly
    withdrawn pursuant to the Offer and no more than 4,801,544 of
    the Common Shares be validly tendered and not properly withdrawn
    through this Offer, and, the Offer is subject to the condition
    that the Merger Condition (as described below) is satisfied. If
    the Merger Condition is not satisfied, we will terminate or
    extend the
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- End box 1 -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    4
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<DIV style="width: 100%; height: 9in; border-top: 1px solid #000000; padding-top: 12pt; border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 12pt; border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; padding-bottom: 12pt; border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 12pt"><!-- Begin box 1 -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Offer. In the event the Offer is terminated, we will promptly
    return any Securities, at our expense, that were delivered
    pursuant to the Offer. See &#147;The Business Combination
    Agreement&#148;.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">What
    are the most significant conditions to the Offer?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Our obligation to purchase Securities validly tendered and not
    properly withdrawn at the Expiration Date is conditioned upon,
    among other things:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the Merger, in our reasonable judgment, is capable of being
    consummated contemporaneously with this Offer, but in no event
    later than three business days after the expiration of this
    Offer. We refer to this condition, which is not waivable, as the
    &#147;Merger Condition&#148;;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    no more than 4,801,544 Common Shares are validly tendered and
    not properly withdrawn prior to the Expiration Date. We refer to
    this condition, which is not waivable, as the &#147;Maximum
    Tender Condition&#148;;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the aggregate consideration payable as Stock Purchase Price and
    Warrant Purchase Price to tendering holders pursuant to this
    Offer not exceeding $9,156,300. We refer to this condition,
    which is waivable, subject to the consent of Crumbs under the
    terms of the Business Combination Agreement as the &#147;Cash
    Condition&#148;.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In addition, the Offer is also subject to a number of other
    conditions, such as there not being instituted or pending, at
    any time after the commencement of the Offer and before the
    Expiration Date, any action, suit or proceeding by any
    government or governmental, regulatory or administrative agency,
    authority or tribunal or by any other person, domestic, foreign
    or supranational, before any court, authority, agency or other
    tribunal that directly or indirectly, challenges or seeks to
    make illegal, or to delay or otherwise directly or indirectly to
    restrain or prohibit the making of the Offer or the acquisition
    of some or all of the Securities pursuant to the Offer. We refer
    to the conditions to the Offer, including the Merger Condition,
    Maximum Tender Condition and Cash Condition, as the &#147;offer
    conditions.&#148; See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Conditions of
    the Offer.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Will
    there be a single controlling stockholder of 57th Street
    following the completion of the Merger?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    No. However, immediately following the Merger the Members will
    collectively hold voting securities representing approximately
    39.15% of the voting power of 57th Street assuming no
    Contingency Consideration is issued, no Common Shares are
    tendered in the Offer, no Warrants are exercised and no
    securities are issued pursuant to the Incentive Plan and will
    have the right to appoint a majority of the board of directors
    of 57th Street during the period in which the Contingency
    Consideration is earned. In addition, the Members collectively
    may be entitled to additional Contingency Consideration which
    when aggregated with the Equity Consideration will represent
    approximately 57.79% of the voting power of 57th Street assuming
    no Common Shares are tendered in the Offer, no Warrants are
    exercised and no securities are issued pursuant to the Incentive
    Plan. See &#147;Beneficial Ownership of 57th Street
    Securities&#148; for more detail on the beneficial ownership of
    57th Street following the Merger.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Why
    are we making the Offer?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We are making the Offer in connection with the Merger because
    the provisions of our Certificate of Incorporation, as disclosed
    in the prospectus related to our IPO, and the Business
    Combination Agreement require us to conduct the Offer for Common
    Shares to provide our stockholders an opportunity to redeem
    their Common Shares for a pro-rata portion of our
    Trust&#160;Account upon our consummation of a business
    transaction. We also represented that in connection with this
    redemption opportunity, we would provide our securityholders
    with offering documents that contained substantially the same
    financial and other information about our proposed business
    transaction and redemption rights that would otherwise be
    required under Regulation&#160;14A of the Exchange Act, which
    regulates the solicitation of proxies. Accordingly, we are
    making the Offer so that we may provide our securityholders with
    appropriate disclosure regarding the business and finances of
    57th Street, Crumbs and the post-transaction company so that our
    securityholders can decide whether to hold their
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- End box 1 -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    5
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<DIV style="width: 100%; height: 9in; border-top: 1px solid #000000; padding-top: 12pt; border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 12pt; border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; padding-bottom: 12pt; border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 12pt"><!-- Begin box 1 -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Common Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Warrants, or ask that they be redeemed by us pursuant to this
    Offer if the offer conditions are satisfied.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We are making the Offer for all of our issued and outstanding
    Warrants in connection with the Merger because it is also a
    condition of the Business Combination Agreement. We will only
    become obligated to pay the Warrant Purchase Price for each
    Warrant validly tendered and not properly withdrawn at the
    Expiration Date if the offer conditions are satisfied.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Promptly following the scheduled Expiration Date, we will
    publicly announce whether the Merger Condition, Maximum Tender
    Condition, the Cash Condition and the other conditions to this
    Offer have been satisfied or waived and whether the Offer has
    been extended, terminated or delayed. If such conditions are
    satisfied or waived, promptly after the Expiration Date and
    contemporaneous with the completion of the Merger, 57th Street
    shall purchase and pay the Purchase Price for each Security
    validly tendered and not properly withdrawn. Upon consummation
    of the Merger, Merger Sub shall merge with and into Crumbs, with
    Crumbs surviving as a non-wholly-owned subsidiary of
    57th&#160;Street. The Merger would be completed without a
    meeting of 57th Street&#146;s stockholders pursuant to our
    Certificate of Incorporation and the DGCL. See &#147;The
    Transaction&#148;.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">How
    will 57th Street fund the payment for the
    Securities?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We will use funds raised in connection with our IPO which are
    currently held in the Trust&#160;Account for the benefit of our
    securityholders and the proceeds of which will become available
    to us upon consummation of the Merger, to purchase Securities
    tendered in the Offer. See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Source
    and Amount of Funds.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">How
    long do I have to tender my Securities?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    You may tender your Securities pursuant to the Offer until the
    Offer expires on the Expiration Date. Consistent with a
    condition of the Offer,
    57<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">th</SUP>

    Street may need to extend the Offer depending on the timing and
    process of the SEC&#146;s staff review of the Offer to Purchase
    and related materials. The Offer will expire on Tuesday,
    March&#160;22, 2011, at 5:00 p.m., New York City time, unless we
    extend or terminate the Offer. See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151;
    Number of Shares and Warrants; Purchase Price; No
    Proration&#148; and &#147;&#151;&#160;Extension of the Offer;
    Termination; Amendment.&#148; If a broker, dealer, commercial
    bank, trust company or other nominee holds your Securities, it
    is likely the nominee has established an earlier deadline for
    you to act to instruct the nominee to accept the Offer on your
    behalf. We urge you to contact the broker, dealer, commercial
    bank, trust company or other nominee to find out the
    nominee&#146;s deadline. See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151;
    Procedures for Tendering Shares and Warrants.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Can
    the Offer be extended, amended or terminated and, if so, under
    what circumstances?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We may extend or amend the Offer to the extent we determine such
    extension or amendment is necessary or is required by applicable
    law or regulation, subject to certain restrictions in the
    Business Combination Agreement. If we extend the Offer, we will
    delay the acceptance of any Securities that have been validly
    tendered and not properly withdrawn pursuant to the Offer. We
    can also terminate the Offer if any of the offer conditions
    listed in &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Conditions of the
    Offer&#148; occur, or the occurrence thereof has not been
    waived. See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Extension of the Offer;
    Termination; Amendment.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">How
    will I be notified if the Offer is extended or
    amended?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    If the Offer is extended, we will make a public announcement of
    the extension no later than 9:00&#160;a.m., New York City time,
    on the first business day after the previously scheduled
    Expiration Date. We will announce any amendment to the Offer by
    making a public announcement of the amendment. See &#147;The
    Offer&#160;&#151; Extension of the Offer; Termination;
    Amendment.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">How do
    I tender my Securities?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    If you hold your Securities in your own name as a holder of
    record and decide to tender your Securities, you must deliver
    your Securities by mail or physical delivery and deliver a
    completed and signed Letter of
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- End box 1 -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    6
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<DIV style="width: 100%; height: 9in; border-top: 1px solid #000000; padding-top: 12pt; border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 12pt; border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; padding-bottom: 12pt; border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 12pt"><!-- Begin box 1 -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Transmittal (for Common Shares or Warrants, as the case may be)
    or an Agent&#146;s Message (as defined in &#147;The
    Offer&#160;&#151; Procedures for Tendering Shares and
    Warrants&#148;) to Continental Stock Transfer&#160;&#038;
    Trust&#160;Company (the &#147;Depositary&#148;) before 5:00
    p.m., New York City time, on Tuesday, March&#160;22, 2011, or
    such later time and date to which we may extend the Offer.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    If you hold your Securities in a brokerage account or otherwise
    through a broker, dealer, commercial bank, trust company or
    other nominee (i.e., in &#147;street name&#148;), you must
    contact your broker or other nominee if you wish to tender your
    Securities. See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Procedures for
    Tendering Shares and Warrants&#148; and the instructions to the
    Letter of Transmittal.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    If you are an institution participating in The Depository
    Trust&#160;Company, you must tender your Common Shares or
    Warrants, as the case may be, according to the procedure for
    book-entry transfer described in &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151;
    Procedures for Tendering Common Shares and Warrants&#148; of
    this Offer to Purchase.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    You may contact Morrow&#160;&#038; Co., LLC (the
    &#147;Information Agent&#148;) or your broker for assistance.
    The telephone numbers and
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">e-mail</FONT>
    address for the Information Agent are set forth on the back
    cover of this Offer to Purchase. See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151;
    Procedures for Tendering Shares and Warrants&#148; and the
    instructions to the Letter of Transmittal.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Can I
    tender my units?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    No. If you hold units, comprised of one Common Share and a
    Warrant to acquire one Common Share and desire to tender the
    Common Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Warrants, as the case may be, included in such units, you must
    separate the Common Shares and Warrants that comprise the units
    prior to tendering your Securities pursuant to the Offer. You
    may instruct your broker to do so, or if you hold units
    registered in your own name, you must contact the Depositary
    directly and instruct them to do so. If you fail to cause your
    Securities to be separated in a timely manner before the Offer
    expires you may not be able to validly tender your Common Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Warrants prior to the expiration of this Offer. See &#147;The
    Offer&#160;&#151; Procedures for Tendering Shares and
    Warrants.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Until
    what time can I withdraw previously tendered
    Securities?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    You may withdraw your tendered Securities at any time prior 5:00
    p.m., New York City time, on Tuesday, March&#160;22, 2011, or
    such later time and date to which we may extend the Offer. <B>In
    addition, unless we have already accepted your tendered
    Securities for payment, you may withdraw your tendered
    Securities at any time after 5:00 p.m., New York City time on
    Tuesday, April&#160;19, 2011.</B> See &#147;The
    Offer&#160;&#151; Withdrawal Rights.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">How do
    I properly withdraw Securities previously
    tendered?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    You must deliver, on a timely basis, a written notice of your
    withdrawal to the Depositary at the address appearing on the
    back cover page of this Offer. Your notice of withdrawal must
    specify your name, the number of Common Shares or Warrants, as
    the case may be, to be withdrawn and the name of the registered
    holder of such Securities. Certain additional requirements apply
    if the certificates for Common Shares or Warrants, as the case
    may be, to be withdrawn have been delivered to the Depositary or
    if your Securities have been tendered under the procedure for
    book-entry transfer set forth in &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151;
    Procedures for Tendering Shares and Warrants.&#148; See
    &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Withdrawal Rights.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Has
    57th Street or its board of directors adopted a position on the
    Offer?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Our board of directors has unanimously approved our making the
    Offer, (declared the advisability of the Merger and approved the
    Business Combination Agreement and the transactions contemplated
    by the Business Combination Agreement. Furthermore, our board of
    directors has determined that the Merger is in the best
    interests of the stockholders of 57th&#160;Street and if
    consummated would constitute our initial business transaction
    pursuant to our Certificate of Incorporation. If you tender your
    Common Shares into the offer, you will not be participating in
    the Merger and therefore, our board of directors unanimously
    recommends that you do not
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- End box 1 -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
