</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<DIV style="width: 100%; height: 9in; border-top: 1px solid #000000; padding-top: 12pt; border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 12pt; border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; padding-bottom: 12pt; border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 12pt"><!-- Begin box 1 -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    accept the offer with respect to your Common Shares. However,
    neither we, our board of directors, the Information Agent, nor
    the Depositary for the Offer is making any recommendation to you
    as to whether you should tender or refrain from tendering your
    Warrants pursuant to the Offer. You must make your own decision
    as to whether to tender your Securities and, if so, how many
    Common Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Warrants, as the case may be, to tender. In doing so, you should
    read carefully the information in this Offer to Purchase and in
    the related Letter of Transmittal.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">When
    and how will 57th Street pay for the Securities I tender that
    are accepted for purchase?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We will pay the Stock Purchase Price or Warrant Purchase Price,
    as the case may be, in cash, without interest, for the
    Securities we purchase promptly after (i)&#160;the expiration of
    the Offer if the offer conditions are satisfied, and
    (ii)&#160;our acceptance of the Securities for payment. We will
    pay for the Securities accepted for purchase by depositing the
    aggregate Purchase Price with the Depositary promptly after the
    expiration of the Offer provided that the offer conditions are
    met. The Depositary will act as your agent and will transmit to
    you the payment for all of your Common Shares and Warrants
    accepted for payment. See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Purchase
    of Shares and Warrants and Payment of Purchase Price.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Will I
    have to pay brokerage fees and commissions if I tender my
    Securities?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    If you are a holder of record of your Securities and you tender
    your Securities directly to the Depositary, you will not incur
    any brokerage fees or commissions. If you hold your Securities
    in street name through a broker, bank or other nominee and your
    broker tenders Securities on your behalf, your broker may charge
    you a fee for doing so. We urge you to consult your broker or
    nominee to determine whether any charges will apply. See
    &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Procedure for Tendering Shares.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">What
    are the U.S. federal income tax consequences if I tender my
    Securities?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The receipt of cash for your tendered Common Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Warrants will generally be treated for U.S.&#160;federal income
    tax purposes either as (i)&#160;a sale or exchange eligible for
    capital gain or loss treatment or (ii)&#160;a corporate
    distribution. See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; U.S.&#160;Federal
    Income Tax Consequences.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Will I
    have to pay stock transfer tax if I tender my
    Securities?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We will not pay any stock transfer taxes in connection with this
    Offer. If you instruct the Depositary in the Letter of
    Transmittal to make the payment for the Common Shares or
    Warrants, as the case may be, to the registered holder, you may
    incur domestic stock transfer tax. See &#147;The
    Offer&#160;&#151; Purchase of Shares and Warrants and Payment of
    Purchase Price.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Who do
    I contact if I have questions about the Offer?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    For additional information or assistance, you may contact the
    Information Agent at the telephone numbers and
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">e-mail</FONT>
    address set forth on the back cover of this Offer to Purchase.
    You may request additional copies of the Offer, the Letter of
    Transmittal and other Offer documents from the Information Agent
    at Morrow&#160;&#038; Co., LLC, 470&#160;West Avenue,
    3<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">rd</SUP>

    Floor, Stamford, CT 06902.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Common
    Stock</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">How
    many Common Shares is 57th Street offering to
    purchase?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We are offering to purchase up to 4,801,544 of the Common Shares
    validly tendered in the Offer. See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151;
    Number of Shares and Warrants; Purchase Price; No
    Proration&#148; and &#147;&#151;&#160;Purpose of the Offer;
    Certain Effects of the Offer.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Offer is not conditioned on any minimum number of Common
    Shares being tendered by stockholders. However, the Offer is
    conditioned on no more than 4,801,544 Common Shares being
    validly tendered and not properly withdrawn. See &#147;The
    Offer&#160;&#151; Number of Shares and Warrants; Purchase Price;
    No Proration.&#148;
</DIV>

</DIV><!-- End box 1 -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<DIV style="width: 100%; height: 9in; border-top: 1px solid #000000; padding-top: 12pt; border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 12pt; border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; padding-bottom: 12pt; border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 12pt"><!-- Begin box 1 -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">If
    more than 4,801,544 Common Shares are validly tendered and not
    properly withdrawn or the Cash Condition is not satisfied, will
    57th Street purchase the Common Shares tendered on a pro rata
    basis?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    No. The Offer contains a Maximum Tender Condition that no more
    than 4,801,544 Common Shares are validly tendered and not
    properly withdrawn prior to the Expiration Date and a Cash
    Condition limiting the aggregate consideration payable to
    security holders tendering in the Offer. Accordingly, if more
    than 4,801,544 Common Shares or Securities representing
    aggregate consideration payable under the Offer in excess of
    $9,156,300 are validly tendered and not properly withdrawn we
    will terminate or extend the Offer. See &#147;The
    Offer&#160;&#151; Number of Shares and Warrants; Purchase Price;
    No Proration.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">What
    will be the purchase price for the Common Shares and what will
    be the form of payment?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Stock Purchase Price for the Offer is $9.98 per share. All
    Common Shares we purchase will be purchased at the Stock
    Purchase Price. See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Number of Shares
    and Warrants; Purchase Price; No Proration.&#148; If your Common
    Shares are purchased in the Offer, you will be paid the Stock
    Purchase Price, in cash, without interest, promptly after the
    Expiration Date (as defined in &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151;
    Number of Shares and Warrants; Purchase Price; No
    Proration&#148;). Our Certificate of Incorporation requires that
    we offer a price per Common Share equal to the amount held in
    the Trust&#160;Account as of the commencement of this Offer
    <U>plus</U> interest accrued in the trust until two business
    days prior to the consummation of the Transaction, less taxes
    payable, divided by 5,456,300 Common Shares sold as part of the
    units in our IPO. If we need to adjust the Stock Purchase Price
    to comply with our charter, we will amend this Offer and extend
    the Expiration Date for at least 10&#160;days, Under no
    circumstances will we pay interest on the Stock Purchase Price
    other than as required by our Certificate of Incorporation,
    including but not limited to, by reason of any delay in making
    payment. See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Number of Shares and
    Warrants; Purchase Price; No Proration&#148; and
    &#147;&#151;&#160;Purchase of Shares and Warrants and Payment of
    Purchase Price.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">How
    will the Offer affect the number of Common Shares outstanding
    and the number of holders of the Company?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    As of February&#160;18, 2011, we had 6,062,556 outstanding
    Common Shares, of which 5,456,300 Common Shares were issued in
    the IPO. In addition, we had outstanding Warrants to acquire
    9,156,300 Common Shares at an exercise price of $11.50 per share
    that will become exercisable on the later of 30&#160;days after
    the consummation of the Merger or May&#160;19, 2011. If the
    Offer is fully subscribed, we will have approximately 1,261,012
    Common Shares outstanding following the purchase of Common
    Shares tendered pursuant to the Offer (excluding Common Shares
    issuable upon exercise of outstanding Warrants). In addition,
    upon consummation of the Merger, the Members will own 3,900,000
    New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units and
    390,000&#160;shares of 57th&#160;Street Series&#160;A Voting
    Preferred Stock which combined will, subject to certain
    preferential rights, approximate the voting, economic and other
    rights the Members would have, were they to hold 3,900,000
    Common Shares. See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Purpose of the
    Offer; Certain Effects of the Offer&#148; and &#147;Beneficial
    Ownership of 57th Street Securities.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    To the extent any of our stockholders validly tender their
    Common Shares (without subsequently properly withdrawing such
    tendered Common Shares) and that tender is accepted, the number
    of our holders would be reduced. See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151;
    Purpose of the Offer; Certain Effects of the Offer.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Will
    the Sponsor tender its Common Shares in the Offer?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    No. Our Sponsor holds 606,256 Common Shares and has agreed not
    to tender any of its Common Shares pursuant to the Offer. See
    &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Purpose of the Offer; Certain
    Effects of the Offer&#148;.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">What
    will happen if I do not tender my Common Shares?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Stockholders who choose not to tender their Common Shares will
    retain their Common Shares and have a greater percentage of
    ownership in our outstanding Common Shares following the
    completion of the Offer to the extent Common Shares are tendered
    and purchased pursuant to the Offer and the Merger is
    consummated; however, such Common Shares will be subject to
    dilution by the New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- End box 1 -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    9
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<DIV style="width: 100%; height: 9in; border-top: 1px solid #000000; padding-top: 12pt; border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 12pt; border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; padding-bottom: 12pt; border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 12pt"><!-- Begin box 1 -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    and shares of 57th&#160;Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred
    Stock issued to the Members in the Merger
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Common Shares issuable in exchange for such New Crumbs
    Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units. See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151;
    Purpose of the Offer; Certain Effects of the Offer.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">If I
    object to the price being offered for my Common Shares, will I
    have appraisal rights?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    No appraisal rights will be available to you in connection with
    the Offer or the Merger. If the Merger is consummated, we will
    purchase all Common Shares validly tendered and not properly
    withdrawn. See &#147;Appraisal Rights&#148;.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">What
    is the recent market price for the Common Shares?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On February&#160;18, 2011, the last reported sale price on the
    OTC Bulletin&#160;Board was $10.03 per Common Share. You are
    urged to obtain current market quotations for the Common Shares
    before deciding whether to tender your Common Shares. See
    &#147;Price Range of Securities and Dividends.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Will
    the Common Shares be listed on a Stock Exchange following the
    Merger?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Our Securities are currently quoted on the OTC
    Bulletin&#160;Board. Following the Offer, we intend to apply to
    have our Securities listed on the NASDAQ Capital Market but
    there can be no assurance as to the timing or our ability to
    meet the qualification standards. See &#147;Risk
    Factors&#160;&#151; Risks Related to the Offer&#148; and
    &#147;&#151;&#160;Risks Related to 57th Street&#148;.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Warrants</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">How
    many Warrants is 57th Street offering to purchase?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We are offering to purchase all 9,156,300 outstanding Warrants
    that warrantholders validly tender in the Offer or such lesser
    amount of Warrants as are validly tendered and not properly
    withdrawn. The Offer is not conditioned on any minimum or
    maximum number of Warrants being tendered by warrantholders. See
    &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Number of Shares and Warrants;
    Purchase Price; No Proration&#148; and
    &#147;&#151;&#160;Withdrawal Rights.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">What
    will be the purchase price for the Warrants and what will be the
    form of payment?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Warrant Purchase Price for the Offer is $1.00 per warrant,
    net to the seller in cash, without interest. All Warrants that
    we purchase will be purchased at the Warrant Purchase Price. See
    &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Number of Shares and Warrants;
    Purchase Price; No Proration.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    If your Warrants are purchased in the Offer, we will pay you the
    Warrant Purchase Price promptly after the Expiration Date. Under
    no circumstances will we pay interest on the Warrant Purchase
    Price, including but not limited to, by reason of any delay in
    making payment. See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Number of Shares
    and Warrants; Purchase Price; No Proration&#148; and
    &#147;&#151;&#160;Purchase of Shares and Warrants and Payment of
    Purchase Price.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Will
    tendered Warrants be prorated?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    No. We will accept all Warrants that are validly tendered and
    not properly withdrawn. However, if the conditions to the Offer
    are not satisfied (or waived), including the conditions that not
    more than 4,801,544 Common Shares or Securities representing
    aggregate consideration payable under the Offer in excess of
    $9,156,300 being validly tendered and not properly withdrawn
    prior to the Expiration Date, we will extend or terminate the
    Offer and will promptly return all Warrants tendered at our
    expense. See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Conditions of the
    Offer.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Will
    57th Street&#146;s Sponsor tender Warrants in the
    Offer?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Yes. Our Sponsor, which is controlled by certain of our
    officers, directors and advisors, will tender its
    3.5&#160;million Insider Warrants (as defined in the Business
    Combination Agreement) pursuant to the Offer. See &#147;The
    Offer&#160;&#151; Purpose of the Offer, Certain Effects of the
    Offer.&#148;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- End box 1 -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    10
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<DIV style="width: 100%; height: 9in; border-top: 1px solid #000000; padding-top: 12pt; border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 12pt; border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; padding-bottom: 12pt; border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 12pt"><!-- Begin box 1 -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">What
    will happen if I do not tender my Warrants?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Warrantholders who choose not to tender will not receive cash
    for their Warrants and will remain holders of Warrants entitled
    to exercise them on their terms for the purchase of common stock
    commencing the later of 30&#160;days after our completion of a
    business combination and May&#160;19, 2011. See &#147;Risk
    Factors,&#148; &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Purpose of the Offer;
    Certain Effects of the Offer&#148; and &#147;Description of
    Securities.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">What
    is the recent market price for the Warrants?</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On February&#160;18, 2011, the last reported sale price of the
    Warrants on the OTC Bulletin&#160;Board was $1.20 per Warrant.
    You are urged to obtain current market quotations for the
    Warrants before deciding whether to tender your Warrants. See
    &#147;Price Range of Securities and Dividends.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    To the Holders of: Common Shares and Warrants
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    of 57th Street General Acquisition Corp.
</DIV>

<A name='W81625102'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">INTRODUCTION</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    57th&#160;Street General Acquisition Corp. (&#147;57th
    Street&#148;, the &#147;Company&#148;, &#147;we,&#148;
    &#147;us&#148; or &#147;our&#148;) hereby offers to purchase:
    (i)&#160;up to 4,801,544&#160;shares of its common stock, par
    value $0.0001 per share (the &#147;Common Shares&#148;), at a
    purchase price of $9.98 per share, net to the seller in cash,
    without interest (the &#147;Stock Purchase Price&#148;), for a
    total purchase price of up to $47,919,409 and (ii)&#160;all
    9,156,300 of the outstanding warrants, each to purchase one
    share (the &#147;Warrants&#148; and collectively with the Common
    Shares, the &#147;Securities&#148;), at a purchase price of
    $1.00 per Warrant, net to the seller in cash, without interest
    (the &#147;Warrant Purchase Price&#148;) for a total purchase
    price of up to $9,156,300, each upon the terms and subject to
    certain conditions described in this Offer to Purchase and in
    the respective Letter of Transmittal for the Common Shares and
    the Warrants (which together with the Offer to Purchase, as they
    may be amended or supplemented from time to time, constitute the
    &#147;Offer&#148;). Notwithstanding the foregoing, this Offer is
    conditioned upon, among other things, the aggregate
    consideration payable as Stock Purchase Price and Warrant
    Purchase Price to tendering holders pursuant to this Offer not
    exceeding $9,156,300 (which we refer to as the &#147;Cash
    Condition&#148;) and therefore if Common Shares and Warrants
    representing aggregate consideration exceeding such amount are
    tendered, the Cash Condition will not be satisfied. The Stock
    Purchase Price is equal to the per share amount on deposit in
    our Trust&#160;Account (as defined below) as of the commencement
    of the Offer plus interest accrued until two business days prior
    to the consummation of the Transaction (as defined below), less
    taxes payable. Each of the Stock Purchase Price and Warrant
    Purchase Price may be collectively referred to herein as the
    &#147;Purchase Price.&#148; The Offer and the withdrawal rights
    will expire at 5:00&#160;p.m., New York City time, on Tuesday,
    March&#160;22, 2011 unless the Offer is extended (the
    &#147;Expiration Date&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    This Offer is being made pursuant to the terms of a Business
    Combination Agreement dated as of January&#160;9, 2011 and
    amended on February&#160;18, 2011 (such agreement, as may be
    amended from
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">time-to-time,</FONT>
    the &#147;Business Combination Agreement&#148;), among
    57th&#160;Street, 57th&#160;Street Merger Sub LLC, a Delaware
    limited liability company and wholly-owned subsidiary of
    57th&#160;Street (&#147;Merger Sub&#148;), Crumbs Holdings, LLC,
    a Delaware Limited Liability Company (&#147;Crumbs&#148;), the
    members of Crumbs (the &#147;Members&#148;) and the
    representatives of the Members and Crumbs. The Business
    Combination Agreement provides that, subject to the terms and
    conditions contained therein, Merger Sub will be merged with and
    into Crumbs with Crumbs surviving the merger as a non-wholly
    owned subsidiary of 57th Street (the &#147;Merger&#148; and
    together with the Offer and the other transactions contemplated
    by the Business Combination Agreement, the
    &#147;Transaction&#148;). Pursuant to its Certificate of
    Incorporation, as amended (the &#147;Certificate of
    Incorporation&#148;), and the Delaware General Corporation Law
    (the &#147;DGCL&#148;), 57th&#160;Street may consummate a merger
    without stockholder approval by providing all holders of its
    common stock issued as part of its initial public offering
    (&#147;IPO&#148;) with the opportunity to redeem their Common
    Shares through a tender offer pursuant to the tender offer rules
    promulgated under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as
    amended (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;). This Offer is being made
    in part to provide 57th Street stockholders with such
    opportunity to redeem their Common Shares and to allow the
    Merger to be completed without a stockholder vote and as a
    condition of the Business Combination Agreement. See &#147;The
    Offer&#160;&#151; Purpose of the Offer; Certain Effects of the
    Offer.&#148; The Business Combination Agreement is more fully
    described in &#147;The Business Combination Agreement.&#148;
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->
</DIV><!-- End box 1 -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    11
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<DIV style="width: 100%; height: 9in; border-top: 1px solid #000000; padding-top: 12pt; border-right: 1px solid #000000; padding-right: 12pt; border-bottom: 1px solid #000000; padding-bottom: 12pt; border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 12pt"><!-- Begin box 1 -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    If you support our proposed Merger with Crumbs, do not tender
    your Common Shares in this Offer. Our board of directors has
    unanimously (i)&#160;approved our making the Offer,
    (ii)&#160;declared the advisability of the Merger and approved
    the Business Combination Agreement and the transactions
    contemplated by the Business Combination Agreement, and
    (iii)&#160;determined that the Merger is in the best interests
    of the stockholders of 57th&#160;Street and if consummated would
    constitute our initial business transaction pursuant to our
    Certificate of Incorporation. <B>If you tender your Common
    Shares into the Offer, you will not be participating in the
    Merger and therefore, our board of directors unanimously
    recommends that you do not accept the Offer with respect to your
    Common Shares.</B> However, neither we, our board of directors,
    Morrow&#160;&#038; Co., LLC, as the information agent (the
    &#147;Information Agent&#148;), nor Continental Stock
    Transfer&#160;&#038; Trust&#160;Company , as the depositary (the
    &#147;Depositary&#148;), for the Offer is making any
    recommendation to you as to whether to tender or refrain from
    tendering your Warrants pursuant to the Offer. You must make
    your own decision as to whether to tender your Common Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Warrants and, if so, how many Common Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Warrants to tender. In doing so, you should read carefully the
    information in this Offer to Purchase and in the related Letter
    of Transmittal, including the purpose and effects of the Offer.
    See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Purpose of the Offer; Certain
    Effects of the Offer.&#148; You should discuss whether to tender
    your Common Shares
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    Warrants with your broker, if any, or other financial advisor.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    57th Street GAC Holdings LLC, a limited liability company wholly
    owned by our officers, directors and advisors (our
    &#147;Sponsor&#148;) has agreed not to tender any Common Shares
    pursuant to the Offer, and our Sponsor has agreed to tender all
    of its Warrants pursuant to the Offer. See &#147;The
    Offer&#160;&#151; Purpose of the Offer; Certain Effects of the
    Offer&#148; and &#147;Certain Related Transactions of
    57th&#160;Street&#148;.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Tendering securityholders of Common Shares and Warrants who are
    record owners of their Common Shares and Warrants and tender
    directly to the Depositary will not be obligated to pay
    brokerage fees or commissions or, except as otherwise provided
    in Instruction&#160;6 of the Letter of Transmittal, stock
    transfer taxes with respect to the purchase of Common Shares
    pursuant to the Offer. Securityholders who hold their Common
    Shares and Warrants through a broker or bank should consult such
    institution as to whether it charges any service fees. 57th
    Street will pay all charges and expenses of the Depositary and
    the Information Agent incurred in connection with the Offer. See
    &#147;The Offer&#151;&#160;Fees and Expenses.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Offer is not conditioned on any minimum number of Common
    Shares or Warrants being tendered. The Offer is, however,
    subject to certain other conditions, including among other
    things:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the Merger, in our reasonable judgment, is capable of being
    consummated contemporaneously with this Offer, but in no event
    later than three business days after the Expiration of this
    Offer. We refer to this condition, which is not waivable, as the
    &#147;Merger Condition&#148;;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    no more than 4,801,544 Common Shares are validly tendered and
    not properly withdrawn prior to the Expiration Date. We refer to
    this condition, which is not waivable, as the &#147;Maximum
    Tender Condition&#148;;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the aggregate consideration payable as Stock Purchase Price and
    Warrant Purchase Price to tendering holders pursuant to this
    Offer not exceeding $9,156,300 and therefore if Common Shares
    and Warrants representing aggregate consideration exceeding such
    amount are tendered the foregoing condition will not be
    satisfied. We refer to this condition, which is waivable, as the
    &#147;Cash Condition.&#148;
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    See &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; Purchase of Common Shares and
    Warrants and Payment of Purchase Price&#148; and
    &#147;&#151;&#160;Conditions of the Offer.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    If the Cash Condition or the Merger Condition is not satisfied
    or more than 4,801,544 Common Shares are validly tendered and
    not properly withdrawn we will terminate or extend the Offer. If
    we terminate the Offer, we will be unable to consummate the
    Merger.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Certain U.S.&#160;federal income tax consequences of the sale of
    Common Shares and Warrants pursuant to the Offer are described
    in &#147;The Offer&#160;&#151; U.S.&#160;Federal Income Tax
    Consequences.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    This Offer to Purchase and the related Letter of Transmittal
    contain important information that should be read carefully
    before any decision is made with respect to the Offer. Following
    completion of the Merger, it is anticipated that 57th Street
    will propose to change its name to &#147;Crumbs Bake Shop&#148;
    by seeking stockholder approval to amend its Certificate of
    Incorporation.
</DIV>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<A name='W81625103'>

</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the risk that the anticipated benefits of the Transaction may
    not be fully realized or may take longer to realize than
    expected;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    disruption from the Transaction making it more difficult to
    maintain relationships with customers, employees or suppliers;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    a reduction in industry profit margin; the inability to continue
    the development of the Crumbs brand;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    changing interpretations of generally accepted accounting
    principles; continued compliance with government regulations;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    changing legislation and regulatory environments;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the ability to meet the NASDAQ Stock Market listing standards,
    including having the requisite number of round lot holders or
    stockholders;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    a lower return on investment; the inability to manage rapid
    growth; requirements or changes affecting the business in which
    Crumbs is engaged;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the general volatility of the market price of our
    Securities;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    general economic conditions.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    You should carefully consider these risks, in addition to the
    risks factors set forth in the section titled &#147;Risk
    Factors&#148; and other information in this Offer to Purchase
    and in our other filings incorporated by reference with the
    Securities and Exchange Commission (the &#147;SEC&#148;),
    including our Registration Statement on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;S-1,</FONT>
    as amended (File
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">No.&#160;333-163134)</FONT>
    and our Annual Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K</FONT>
    for the fiscal year ended December&#160;31, 2010. The documents
    we file with the SEC, including the reports referred to above,
    also discuss some of the risks that could cause our actual
    results to differ from those contained or implied in the
    forward-looking statements. See &#147;Where You Can Find More
    Information&#148;.
</DIV>
</DIV><!-- End box 1 -->

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<A name='W81625104'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">RISK
    FACTORS</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>You should carefully consider the following risk factors in
    addition to the other information included or incorporated by
    reference in this Offer to Purchase, including matters addressed
    in the section entitled &#147;Forward-Looking Statements&#148;
    before you decide whether to tender Securities in this Offer. As
    57th Street&#146;s operations will be those of Crumbs upon
    completion of the Merger, a number of the following risk factors
    relate to the business and operations of Crumbs and 57th Street,
    as the successor to such business.</I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>The following discussion should be read in conjunction with
    the financial statements and notes to the financial statements
    included herein or incorporated herein by reference, as well as
    our most recent Registration Statement on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;S-1(File</FONT>
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">No.&#160;333-163134</FONT>
    and Annual Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K.</FONT>
    We caution you not to place undue reliance on the
    forward-looking statements contained in this Offer, which speak
    only as of the date hereof.</I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Risks
    Related To The Offer</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">There
    is no guarantee that your decision whether or not to tender your
    Securities will put you in a better future economic
    position.</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We can give no assurance as to the price at which a
    securityholder may be able to sell its Common Shares, or
    Warrants, as the case maybe, in the future following the
    completion of the Offer. If you choose to tender your Securities
    in the Offer, certain future events may cause an increase in our
    stock price or warrant price, as the case may be, and may result
    in a lower value realized now than you might realize in the
    future had you not agreed to tender your Securities. Similarly,
    if you do not tender your Securities, you will continue to bear
    the risk of ownership of your Securities after the closing of
    the Offer, and there can be no assurance that you can sell your
    Securities in the future at a higher price than the Stock
    Purchase Price or the Warrant Purchase Price, respectively. You
    should consult your own individual tax
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    financial advisor for assistance on how this may affect your
    individual situation.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">If
    certain conditions are not met, 57th Street may terminate the
    Offer.</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Upon the consummation of the Merger, we plan to use the cash
    available from the funds held in the Trust&#160;Account to
    purchase the Securities validly tendered and not properly
    withdrawn pursuant to the Offer. Accordingly, if the conditions
    to the Offer are not satisfied, including the Merger Condition,
    Maximum Tender Condition and Cash Condition, we will not be able
    to access the funds held in the Trust&#160;Account and thus will
    terminate or extend the Offer. See &#147;The Tender
    Offer&#160;&#151; Conditions of the Offer.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">The
    Offer presents potential risks and disadvantages to us and our
    continuing securityholders.</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Although our board of directors has unanimously determined that
    the Merger and making the Offer are in the best interests of our
    securityholders, the Offer exposes us to a number of risks
    including:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the use of a substantial portion of the cash in our
    Trust&#160;Account, which may adversely affect our ability to
    consummate the Merger, and reduce the funds available as working
    capital for the Crumbs business, available for significant cash
    acquisitions in the future or available for other business
    opportunities that could create significant value for our
    stockholders;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the risk that we would not be able to replenish our cash
    reserves by raising debt or equity financing in the future on
    terms acceptable to us, or at all;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    the risk that the Offer may reduce our &#147;public float,&#148;
    which is the number of shares owned by non-affiliate
    stockholders and available for trading in the Securities
    markets, and the number of our stockholders, which may reduce
    the volume of trading in our common stock and may result in
    lower stock prices and reduced liquidity in the trading of our
    Common Shares following completion of the Offer and limit our
    ability to meet the to meet the NASDAQ Stock Market listing
    standards.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    14
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Risks
    Related to 57th Street</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Your
    only opportunity to affect the investment decision regarding a
    potential business transaction will be limited to the exercise
    of your right to redeem your Common Shares from us for
    cash.</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Since our board of directors may consummate a business
    transaction without seeking stockholder approval in accordance
    with our Certificate of Incorporation and the DGCL, public
    stockholders will not have the right or opportunity to vote on
    the business transaction, unless we seek such stockholder vote.
    Accordingly, your only opportunity to affect the investment
    decision regarding a potential business transaction may be
    limited to exercising your redemption rights within the period
    of time set forth in this Offer, as amended. In addition, your
    election to exercise your redemption rights could still be
    rejected if the conditions to this Offer are not satisfied.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">If we
    are unable to consummate a business transaction, our public
    stockholders will be forced to wait the full 15&#160;months
    before receiving distributions from our
    Trust&#160;Account.</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We have until August&#160;19, 2011 to complete a business
    transaction. If we do not consummate a business transaction
    within such time, we shall (i)&#160;cease all operations except
    for the purposes of winding up, (ii)&#160;redeem 100% of our
    public Common Shares for a per share pro rata portion of the
    Trust&#160;Account (including interest, but net of any taxes),
    subject to the requirements of applicable law and (iii)&#160;as
    promptly as possible following such redemption, dissolve and
    liquidate the balance of our net assets to our remaining
    stockholders. If we redeem such Common Shares, such redemption
    must comply with the applicable provisions of the DGCL,
    including Section&#160;160 thereof, governing rights of
    redemption. Upon the termination of our corporate existence, the
    balance of our net assets will be distributed to our remaining
    stockholders. Accordingly, if our plan to redeem 100% of our
    Common Shares sold in the IPO is not consummated for any reason,
    compliance with the DGCL may require that we submit a plan of
    dissolution and liquidation to our then existing stockholders
    for approval prior to the distribution of the proceeds held in
    our Trust&#160;Account. In that case, investors may be forced to
    wait beyond August&#160;19, 2011 before the liquidation proceeds
    of our Trust&#160;Account become available to them, and they
    receive the return of their pro rata portion of the proceeds
    from our Trust&#160;Account. Except for the above redemption, we
    have no obligation to return funds to investors prior to the
    date of our liquidation unless we consummate a business
    transaction prior thereto and only then in cases where investors
    have sought to redeem their Common Shares. Only upon our
    liquidation, if no such redemption occurs, will public
    stockholders be entitled to liquidation distributions if we are
    unable to complete a business transaction.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">If the
    Merger is not consummated we will have limited time and
    resources to consummate a different business
    transaction.</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We have until August&#160;19, 2011 to complete a business
    transaction. If we are unable to consummate the Merger, our
    ability to consummate a different business transaction may be
    adversely impacted. For example, we may not have adequate time
    to identify another target, perform due diligence, negotiate a
    definitive agreement related to the business transaction and
    complete a tender offer prior to August&#160;19, 2011.
    Additionally, we would have less funds at our disposal to pay
    for the costs associated with consummating a different business
    transaction. Consequently, if we do not consummate the Merger,
    we may not be able to consummate a different business
    transaction before August&#160;19, 2011.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">If we
    are forced to redeem or liquidate before the completion of a
    business transaction and distribute the Trust&#160;Account, our
    public stockholders may receive less than $9.98 per share and
    our Warrants will expire worthless.</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    If we are unable to complete a business transaction within the
    prescribed time frame and are forced to cease operations and
    ultimately liquidate our assets, the amount of either of the
    (i)&#160;per share redemption or (ii)&#160;per share liquidation
    distribution may be less than $9.98. Furthermore, there will be
    no distribution with respect to our outstanding Warrants which
    will expire worthless if we liquidate before the completion of a
    business transaction.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    15
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Public
    stockholders may receive less than their pro rata share of the
    Trust&#160;Account upon redemption due to claims of
    creditors.</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Our placing of funds in the Trust&#160;Account may not protect
    those funds from third party claims against us. Although we will
    seek to have all vendors, service providers (other than our
    independent accountants), prospective target businesses or other
    entities we engage execute agreements with us waiving any right,
    title, interest or claim of any kind in or to any monies held in
    the Trust&#160;Account for the benefit of our public
    stockholders, such parties may not execute such agreements, or
    even if they execute such agreements they may not be prevented
    from bringing claims against the Trust&#160;Account, including,
    but not limited to, fraudulent inducement, breach of fiduciary
    responsibility or other similar claims, as well as claims
    challenging the enforceability of the waiver, in each case in
    order to gain advantage with respect to a claim against our
    assets, including the funds held in the Trust&#160;Account.
    Accordingly, the (i)&#160;per share redemption price or
    (ii)&#160;per share liquidation price could be less than the
    $10.00 per share held in the Trust&#160;Account, plus interest
    (net of any taxes), due to claims of such creditors.
    Additionally, if we are forced to file a bankruptcy case or an
    involuntary bankruptcy case is filed against us which is not
    dismissed, the funds held in our Trust&#160;Account could be
    subject to applicable bankruptcy law, and may be included as an
    asset in our bankruptcy estate and subject to the claims of
    third parties with priority over the claims of our stockholders.
    To the extent any bankruptcy claims deplete the
    Trust&#160;Account, we may not be able to return $9.98 per share
    to our public stockholders.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Our
    stockholders may be held liable for claims by third parties
    against us to the extent of distributions received by them upon
    redemption of their Common Shares.</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    If we do not consummate a business transaction by
    August&#160;19, 2011, 57th&#160;Street GAC Holdings LLC, a
    limited liability company wholly owned by its officers,
    directors and advisors (our &#147;Sponsor&#148;), and our
    officers and directors have agreed that we will (i)&#160;cease
    all operations except for the purposes of winding up,
    (ii)&#160;redeem 100% of our public Common Shares for a per
    share pro rata portion of the Trust&#160;Account, plus a portion
    of the interest earned on the Trust&#160;Account but net of any
    taxes, subject to the requirements of Section&#160;160 of the
    DGCL and other applicable law and (iii)&#160;as promptly as
    possible following such redemption, dissolve and liquidate the
    balance of our net assets to our remaining stockholders. Under
    the DGCL, stockholders may be held liable for claims by third
    parties against a corporation to the extent of distributions
    received by them pursuant to dissolution, and our redemption of
    100% of the Common Shares sold in the IPO may be deemed a
    liquidating distribution. If a corporation complies with certain
    procedures set forth in Section&#160;280 of the DGCL intended to
    ensure that it makes reasonable provision for all claims against
    it, including a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">60-day</FONT>
    notice period during which any third-party claims can be brought
    against the corporation, a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">90-day</FONT>
    period during which the corporation may reject any claims
    brought, and an additional
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">150-day</FONT>
    waiting period before any liquidating distributions are made to
    stockholders, any liability of stockholders with respect to a
    liquidating distribution is limited to the lesser of such
    stockholder&#146;s pro rata share of the claim or the amount
    distributed to the stockholder, and any liability of the
    stockholder would be barred after the third anniversary of the
    dissolution. Because we will not be complying with certain
    procedures set forth in Section&#160;280 of the DGCL, as set
    forth above, a stockholder who received distributions in the
    redemption may be liable for the lesser of such
    stockholder&#146;s pro rata share of the claim or the amount
    distributed to the stockholder until the third anniversary of
    the dissolution.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Our
    directors may decide not to enforce Messrs.&#160;Klein&#146;s
    and Lapping&#146;s indemnification obligations, resulting in a
    reduction in the amount of funds in the Trust&#160;Account
    available for distribution to our public
    stockholders.</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In the event that the proceeds in the Trust&#160;Account are
    reduced below $9.98 per share and Messrs.&#160;Klein and Lapping
    assert that they are unable to satisfy their obligations or that
    they have no indemnification obligations related to a particular
    claim, our independent directors, if any, would determine
    whether to take legal action against Messrs.&#160;Klein and
    Lapping to enforce their indemnification obligations. While we
    currently expect that our independent directors would take legal
    action on our behalf against Messrs.&#160;Klein and Lapping to
    enforce their indemnification obligations to us, it is possible
    that our independent directors in
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    16
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    exercising their business judgment may choose not to do so in
    any particular instance. If our directors choose not to enforce
    these indemnification obligations, the amount of funds in the
    Trust&#160;Account available for distribution to our public
    stockholders may be reduced below $9.98 per share.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Although
    we are required to use our best efforts to have an effective
    registration statement covering the issuance of the Common
    Shares underlying the Warrants at the time that our
    warrantholders exercise their Warrants, a registration statement
    may not be effective, in which case our warrantholders may not
    be able to exercise their Warrants and therefore the Warrants
    could expire worthless.</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Holders of our Warrants will be able to exercise the Warrants
    for cash only if we have an effective registration statement
    covering the Common Shares issuable upon exercise of the
    Warrants and a current prospectus relating to such common stock
    and, even in the case of a cashless exercise which is permitted
    in certain circumstances, such Common Shares are qualified for
    sale or exempt from qualification under the applicable
    securities laws of the states in which the various holders of
    Warrants reside. Although we have undertaken in the warrant
    agreement, and therefore have a contractual obligation, to use
    our best efforts to maintain an effective registration statement
    covering the Common Shares issuable upon exercise of the
    Warrants, and we intend to comply with our undertaking, we may
    not be able to do so. Factors such as an unexpected inability to
    remain current in our SEC reporting obligations or other
    material developments concerning our business could present
    difficulties in maintaining an effective registration statement
    and a current prospectus. Holders of Warrants will not be
    entitled to a cash settlement for their Warrants if we fail to
    have an effective registration statement or a current prospectus
    available relating to the common stock issuable upon exercise of
    the Warrants. The expiration of Warrants prior to exercise would
    result in each unit holder paying the full unit Purchase Price
    solely for the Common Shares underlying the unit.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Compliance
    with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 will require substantial
    financial and management resources and may increase the time and
    costs of completing an acquisition.</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Section&#160;404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 requires that
    we evaluate and report on our system of internal controls and
    requires that we have such system of internal controls audited
    beginning with our Annual Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K</FONT>
    for the year ending December&#160;31, 2011. If we fail to
    maintain the adequacy of our internal controls, we could be
    subject to regulatory scrutiny, civil or criminal penalties
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    stockholder litigation. Any inability to provide reliable
    financial reports could harm our business. Crumbs may not be in
    compliance with the provisions of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act
    regarding adequacy of their internal controls. The development
    of the internal controls of Crumbs to achieve compliance with
    the Sarbanes-Oxley Act may increase the time and costs necessary
    to complete any such acquisition. Furthermore, any failure to
    implement required new or improved controls, or difficulties
    encountered in the implementation of adequate controls over our
    financial processes and reporting in the future, could harm our
    operating results or cause us to fail to meet our reporting
    obligations. Inferior internal controls could also cause
    investors to lose confidence in our reported financial
    information, which could have a negative effect on the trading
    price of our Securities.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Our
    securities are quoted on the OTC Bulletin&#160;Board, which
    limits the liquidity and price of our securities more than if
    our securities were quoted or listed on the NASDAQ Capital
    Market or another national exchange.</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Our units, Common Shares and Warrants are traded in the
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">over-the-counter</FONT>
    market and quoted on the OTC Bulletin&#160;Board, a
    FINRA-Sponsored and operated inter-dealer automated quotation
    system for equity securities not included in the NASDAQ Capital
    Market. Quotation of our securities on the OTC
    Bulletin&#160;Board limits the liquidity and price of our
    Securities more than if our Securities were quoted or listed on
    the NASDAQ Capital Market or a national exchange. Lack of
    liquidity limits the price at which you may be able to sell our
    Securities or your ability to sell our Securities at all.
    Although we have filed an application to list our securities on
    the NASDAQ Capital Market upon the consummation of the
    Transaction, there can be no assurance as to the timing or
    whether we will meet the initial or continued listing
    qualifications.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    17
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->
