<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="6%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="92%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    3,900,000 New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units, which
    shall be exchangeable for 3,900,000 Common Shares (subject to
    certain adjustments related to organic dilution) at the request
    from time to time of any holder of any such New Crumbs
    Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units pursuant to the terms of an
    Exchange and Support Agreement between the Member, Crumbs and
    57th Street. See &#147;Related Agreements&#160;&#151; Exchange
    and Support Agreement&#148; for more information about the
    Exchange and Support Agreement;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    390,000&#160;shares of 57th Street Series&#160;A Voting
    Preferred Stock, which shall among other things entitle the
    holders of such shares of 57th Street Series&#160;A Voting
    Preferred Stock the right to vote 10 votes per share in all
    maters for which the Common Shares are entitled to vote and
    provide the holder of such 57th Street Series&#160;A Voting
    Preferred Stock voting as a class the right to appoint a
    majority of the our board of directors, during the Earn-out
    Period. Shares of 57th Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred
    Stock will be proportionately redeemed upon exchange of shares
    of New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units. See
    &#147;Description of Securities&#148; for more information about
    the terms of the 57th Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred
    Stock.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Equity Consideration, when combined will, subject to certain
    preferential rights, approximate the voting, economic and other
    rights the Members would have were they to hold 3,900,000 Common
    Shares, representing 39.15% of the outstanding Common Shares of
    57th&#160;Street after giving effect to the Merger and the
    issuance of the Equity Consideration and assuming no Contingency
    Consideration (as defined below) is issued, no Common Shares are
    tendered in the Offer, no Warrants are exercised and no
    securities are issued pursuant to the Incentive Plan (as defined
    in the Business Combination Agreement). See &#147;The Business
    Combination Agreement&#160;&#151; Merger Consideration to be
    Delivered&#148; for a further description of the Equity
    Consideration.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The consideration payable at Closing shall be subject to
    adjustment based upon the actual adjusted net working capital of
    Crumbs as of the Closing.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In addition, the Members will be entitled to receive will be
    entitled to receive the following additional consideration in
    exchange for their Old Crumbs Units upon either the achievement
    of certain financial targets and stock price targets during the
    Earnout Period or upon the occurrence of certain acceleration
    events:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Up to 4,400,000 New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable
    Units;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Up to 440,000&#160;shares of the Series&#160;A voting preferred
    stock of 57th Street, par value $0.001 per share (the
    &#147;57th&#160;Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred
    Stock&#148;).
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Contingency Consideration combined will, subject to certain
    preferential rights, approximate the voting, economic and other
    rights the Members would have were they to hold 4,400,000 Common
    Shares, when aggregated with the Equity Consideration and the
    Members&#146; voting power, would represent 57.79% of the
    outstanding Common Shares after giving effect to the Merger and
    the issuance of the Equity Consideration and Contingency
    Consideration and assuming no Common Shares are tendered in the
    Offer, no Warrants are exercised and no securities are issued
    pursuant to the Incentive Plan. See &#147;The Business
    Combination Agreement&#160;&#151; Merger Consideration to be
    Delivered&#148; for a further description of the Contingency
    Consideration.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The issued and outstanding membership interests of Merger Sub,
    which are all currently held by 57th Street, will automatically
    be converted into a number of New Crumbs Class&#160;A Voting
    Units equal to the number of Common Shares issued and
    outstanding as of the completion of the Merger after giving
    effect to the Offer, and 57th Street shall cease to have any
    other rights in and to Merger Sub (and Crumbs as the surviving
    entity from the Merger).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Please see the diagram in &#147;Summary Term Sheet and Questions
    and Answers&#148; that depicts our organizational structure
    immediately following this Offer and the Transaction.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    38
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">The
    Offer</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Concurrently with the Merger, 57th Street will (a)&#160;provide
    its stockholders with the opportunity to redeem their Common
    Shares for cash equal to their pro rata share of the aggregate
    amount then on deposit in the Trust&#160;Account set up to hold
    the net proceeds of 57th Street&#146;s IPO, plus interest
    accrued until two business days prior to the consummation of the
    Transaction, less taxes payable, upon the consummation of the
    Merger (the &#147;Tender Offer&#148;) and (b)&#160;provide
    holders of its Warrants with the opportunity to redeem their
    Warrants for cash upon consummation of the Merger (the
    &#147;Warrant Tender Offer&#148;). The parties to the Business
    Combination Agreement have determined to conduct the Tender
    Offer and Warrant Tender Offer as one simultaneous offer. For
    purposes of this Offer to Purchase we refer to the combination
    of the Tender Offer and the Warrant Tender Offer collectively as
    the &#147;Offer&#148; 57th Street&#146;s board of directors has
    unanimously (i)&#160;approved our making the Offer,
    (ii)&#160;declared the advisability of the Merger and approved
    the Business Combination Agreement and the transactions
    contemplated by the Business Combination Agreement, and
    (iii)&#160;determined that the Merger is in the best interests
    of the stockholders of 57th&#160;Street and if consummated would
    constitute our initial business transaction pursuant to our
    Certificate of Incorporation
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    57th Street will be issued the New Crumbs Class&#160;A Voting
    Units. Pursuant to its Certificate of Incorporation, 57th Street
    will designate a new series of Preferred Stock as 57th Street
    Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock which will be issued to
    each Member.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Related Agreements.</I>&#160;&#160;In addition to the
    Business Combination Agreement the parties to the Business
    Combination Agreement will enter into certain other related
    agreements at Closing, including the Employment Agreements,
    Lockup Agreement, Exchange and Support Agreement, Third
    Amended&#160;&#038; Restated LLC Agreement, Tax Receivables
    Agreement and Registration Rights Agreement. The proposed terms
    of such agreements are described in greater detail below under
    the heading &#147;The Related Agreements.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Background
    of the Transaction</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The terms of the Business Combination Agreement are the result
    of negotiations between the representatives of 57th Street and
    Crumbs. The following is a brief description of the background
    of these negotiations, and the related transactions.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    57th Street was formed on October&#160;29, 2009 and is a blank
    check company organized under the laws of the State of Delaware.
    It was formed to acquire, through a merger, capital stock
    exchange, asset acquisition, stock purchase, reorganization,
    exchangeable share transaction or other similar business
    transaction, one or more operating businesses or assets.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    A registration statement for 57th&#160;Street&#146;s IPO was
    declared effective on May&#160;19, 2010. On May&#160;25, 2010,
    57th&#160;Street consummated its IPO of 5,000,000&#160;units
    (the &#147;Units&#148;). On May&#160;28, 2010, 57th Street
    consummated the closing of an additional 456,300&#160;units
    pursuant to the exercise of the underwriters&#146;
    over-allotment option. Each Unit consists of one Common Share of
    57th Street and one Warrant. Each Warrant will entitle its
    holder to purchase from 57th Street one Common Share at an
    exercise price of $11.50 commencing on the later of
    (a)&#160;May&#160;19, 2011 or (b)&#160;30&#160;days following
    the completion of a business transaction, and will expire five
    (5)&#160;years from the date of the consummation of the business
    transaction. The Warrants may be redeemed by 57th Street at a
    price of $0.01 per Warrant upon 30&#160;days prior notice after
    the Warrants become exercisable, only in the event that the last
    sale price of the Common Shares are at least $17.50 per share
    for any 20 trading days within a 30 trading day period ending on
    the third business day prior to the date on which notice of
    redemption is given. The Common Shares and Warrants started
    trading separately on June&#160;10, 2010.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Units were sold at an offering price of $10.00 per unit,
    bringing total gross proceeds to 57th Street from the
    5,456,300&#160;units sold in its IPO (including the
    456,300&#160;units sold pursuant to the over-allotment option)
    to $54,563,000. A total of $54,476,303 (including the proceeds
    of a previously announced private placement of 3,700,000
    warrants for $1,850,000 to 57th Street&#146;s sponsor,
    57th&#160;Street GAC Holdings, LLC and the underwriters of the
    IPO) has been placed in the Trust&#160;Account.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    39
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Prior to the consummation of its IPO, neither 57th&#160;Street,
    nor anyone on its behalf, contacted any prospective target
    business or had any substantive discussions, formal or
    otherwise, with respect to such a transaction with
    57th&#160;Street.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Subsequent to the consummation of the IPO on May&#160;25, 2010,
    57th&#160;Street commenced consideration of potential target
    companies with the objective of consummating a business
    transaction. 57th&#160;Street compiled a list of potential
    targets and updated and supplemented such list from time to
    time. The total number of potential acquisition targets
    eventually considered by 57th&#160;Street exceeded 55.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    During the period from the closing of its IPO to January&#160;9,
    2010, 57th&#160;Street:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    participated in in-person or telephonic discussions with
    representatives of over 55 potential acquisition targets other
    than Crumbs;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    entered into non-disclosure agreements with 19 potential
    acquisition targets other than Crumbs, or their
    representatives;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    entered into letters of intent and conducted diligence with
    respect to three potential acquisition targets, including Crumbs.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    57th Street reviewed the potential acquisition targets based on
    the same criteria discussed below and used in evaluating the
    Transaction, which include revenue growth opportunities,
    financial results, competitive position, industry dynamics and
    management experience, and narrowed its focus based on the
    interest expressed by the potential targets. Of the 55 potential
    targets that expressed interest, discussions progressed to a
    point of sufficient mutual interest that 57th Street entered
    into non-disclosure agreements with 19 of such targets. Based on
    the criteria described herein, 57th Street&#146;s analysis of
    the potential partners progressed to the due diligence phase
    with respect to only three companies including Crumbs. None of
    the other potential acquisition targets considered by 57th
    Street were comparable to Crumbs because they did not operate in
    the same industry as Crumbs.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On October&#160;20, 2010 Mark Klein, 57th&#160;Street&#146;s
    Chief Executive Officer, met with Keith Miller with Goode
    Partners LLC and Mr.&#160;Miller offered to introduce 57th
    Street to Crumbs&#146; investors and management. During the
    meeting, Mr.&#160;Klein and Mr.&#160;Miller discussed the
    general terms of a finder&#146;s agreement. Following the
    meeting, Mr.&#160;Miller arranged for Mr.&#160;Klein to meet
    with Edwin Lewis, a director of, and an investor in, Crumbs. On
    February&#160;3, 2011, 57th Street entered into a Finder&#146;s
    Agreement with Cynthia Lane, LLC, an entity controlled by
    Mr.&#160;Miller. The agreement memorializing the authorization
    of Mr.&#160;Miller on a non-exclusive basis, to identify and
    refer potential acquisition candidates for a business
    combination to 57th Street. Pursuant to such agreement, 57th
    Street is required to pay a finder&#146;s fee to Cynthia Lane,
    LLC if any prospect introduced by Mr.&#160;Miller leads to the
    consummation of a business transaction.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On October&#160;26, 2010, Mark Klein had an initial meeting with
    Edwin Lewis at 57th Street&#146;s office. During the meeting,
    Mr.&#160;Klein provided an overview of special purpose
    acquisition corporations and Mr.&#160;Lewis provided an overview
    of Crumbs.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On October&#160;27, 2010 Mr.&#160;Klein met with Mr.&#160;Lewis
    and Jason Bauer, Crumbs&#146; Chief Executive Officer, at 57th
    Street&#146;s office. Paul Lapping, 57th Street&#146;s CFO
    participated in the meeting by phone. Management from both
    companies provided overviews of their respective businesses.
    Following the meeting, Mr.&#160;Lapping forwarded materials
    describing 57th Street and a non disclosure agreement to
    Mr.&#160;Bauer. On October 28th, Crumbs and 57th Street executed
    the non disclosure agreement. On October 29th, 57th Street
    received an initial package of confidential information
    regarding Crumbs from Mr.&#160;Bauer.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On November&#160;1, 2010, 57th&#160;Street management, including
    Mr.&#160;Klein and Mr.&#160;Lapping together with Jason Bauer,
    reviewed a potential transaction with representatives from
    Morgan Joseph and Co. Inc. (&#147;Morgan Joseph&#148;),
    Ladenburg Thalmann, each of whom were underwriters of 57th
    Street&#146;s IPO, and B. Riley, as a potential advisor to 57th
    Street.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On November&#160;3, 2010, 57th Street sent Mr.&#160;Bauer and
    Mr.&#160;Lewis a financial model illustrating a business
    combination between 57th Street and Crumbs. Mr.&#160;Klein met
    with Mr.&#160;Bauer and Mr.&#160;Lewis, who participated
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    40
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    by phone, on November&#160;5, 2010 and reviewed the financial
    model. On November&#160;9, 2010, Mr.&#160;Klein and
    Mr.&#160;Bauer met at 57th Street&#146;s office to discuss a
    revised financial model.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On November&#160;11, 2010, representatives of 57th Street and
    Crumbs management, together with their respective tax counsels,
    had a conference call to discuss tax considerations.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On November&#160;16, 2010, Messrs.&#160;Klein, Lapping, Bauer
    and Miller met with Tom Chin and Dana Telsey of the Telsey Group
    to discuss the potential Transaction between Crumbs and 57th
    Street. By letter agreement dated February&#160;8, 2010, between
    57th Street and Telsey Advisory Group LLC (&#147;TAG&#148;), TAG
    agreed to act as financial and capital markets adviser in
    connection with the Transaction and perform such services for
    57th&#160;Street as are customary and appropriate in
    transactions such as the business transaction.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On November&#160;29, 57th Street management, Jason Bauer and
    John Ireland, Crumbs&#146; CFO, and representatives of Morgan
    Joseph had a conference call during which Crumbs historical
    financial results and the format for preparation of more
    detailed projections were reviewed
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    57th Street thereupon requested its counsel, Ellenoff
    Grossman&#160;&#038; Schole LLP (&#147;EGS&#148;) to prepare a
    draft letter of intent for discussion purposes.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On December&#160;6, 2010, 57th Street sent Crumbs an initial
    draft letter of intent. On December&#160;7, 2010, 57th Street
    reviewed the letter of intent with Jason Bauer and his counsel
    via teleconference. On December&#160;17, 2010, Crumbs and 57th
    Street executed the letter of intent.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On December&#160;20, 2010, 57th Street held a meeting of its
    board of directors and advisory board to review the Crumbs
    transaction.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On December&#160;23, 2010, 57th Street and its counsel, EGS,
    provided a draft Business Combination Agreement to Crumbs and
    its counsel, Akin Gump Strauss Hauer&#160;&#038; Feld LLP
    (&#147;AGSHF&#148;). Subsequently, Mark Klein and Paul Lapping
    of 57th Street, Jason Bauer, Edwin Lewis and John Ireland of
    Crumbs, 57th Street&#146;s counsel and Crumbs&#146; counsel held
    various meetings and conference calls to negotiate the terms of
    the Business Combination Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On January&#160;7, 2011, the board of directors of 57th Street
    held a special meeting. At this meeting, the board of directors
    received a presentation from Mark Klein and Paul Lapping
    presenting a synopsis of the proposed transaction and background
    of Crumbs. The 57th&#160;Street board of directors also received
    a presentation from Douglas S. Ellenoff of EGS as to the legal
    terms of the Transaction and due diligence. Following the
    presentations, and after discussions thereon, the 57th Street
    board of directors unanimously approved the proposed Transaction
    and authorized the officers of 57th Street to execute the
    Transaction documents.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On January&#160;9, 2011, the Business Combination Agreement was
    executed by the parties. Prior to the opening of the financial
    markets on January&#160;10, 2011, 57th&#160;Street and Crumbs
    issued a press release announcing the Transaction.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On February&#160;18, 2011, the parties amended certain
    provisions of the Business Combination Agreement, and on
    February&#160;22, 2010, issued a press release announcing the
    amendment. See &#147;The Business Combination
    Agreement&#160;&#151; Amendment to the Business Combination
    Agreement.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">57th
    Street&#146;s Board of Directors&#146; Reasons for the Approval
    of the Transaction</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Based upon its evaluation, 57th&#160;Street&#146;s board of
    directors unanimously approved the Transaction with Crumbs and
    determined that it is in the best interests of 57th&#160;Street
    and its stockholders.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    57th&#160;Street&#146;s board of directors considered a wide
    variety of factors in connection with its evaluation of the
    Transaction. In light of the complexity of those factors, its
    board of directors, as a whole, did not consider it practicable
    to, nor did it attempt to, quantify or otherwise assign relative
    weights to the specific factors it considered in reaching its
    decision. Individual members of 57th&#160;Street&#146;s board of
    directors may have given different weight to different factors.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    41
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    57th&#160;Street&#146;s board of directors considered the nature
    of the business of Crumbs, its current capitalization and
    operating results, the extent of the liabilities to be assumed
    and the factors below, in addition to the various risks
    discussed in the section entitled &#147;Risk Factors&#148;, in
    reaching its determination that the Transaction is in the best
    interests of 57th&#160;Street&#146;s stockholders and to approve
    the Transaction.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In considering the Transaction, 57th&#160;Street&#146;s board of
    directors gave consideration to the following positive factors
    (although not weighted or in any order of significance):
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <I>Opportunities to grow existing revenue streams and create new
    revenue streams associated with Crumbs.</I>&#160;&#160;An
    important criteria to 57th&#160;Street&#146;s board of directors
    in identifying a Transaction target was that the target business
    could support long term growth through economic cycles. The
    board of directors believes Crumbs&#146; infrastructure of
    branding, growth, customer loyalty, quality and intellectual
    capital are in place to facilitate such growth. Primary growth
    strategy includes operating an aggregate of 200 retail stores by
    2014, increasing
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">e-commerce</FONT>
    operations, continuing to invest in brand development and
    penetrating new markets.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <I>The financial results of Crumbs, including potential for
    revenue growth and improved operating
    margins.</I>&#160;&#160;The board of directors evaluated
    Crumbs&#146; operating cost structure and transaction economics
    in its current business segments and growth initiatives. Based
    upon Crumbs&#146; prospects, the board of directors determined
    Crumbs would have the ability to leverage its infrastructure and
    fixed costs and improve margins as it grows.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <I>The industry dynamics, including barriers to entry and the
    competitive position of Crumbs.</I>&#160;&#160;Another
    investment criteria the board of directors reviewed was the
    existence of barriers to entry and Crumbs&#146; competitive
    position. Crumbs believes it is the creator of the gourmet
    cupcake, and the largest U.S.&#160;based retailer of cupcakes.
    Crumbs has developed unique and innovative recipes, and engaged
    the services of commercial bakers to deliver consistent quality
    products to each of its retail stores, as well as to customers
    purchasing their cupcakes or other baked goods on-line.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <I>Crumbs&#146; experienced management
    team.</I>&#160;&#160;Another important criteria to
    57th&#160;Street&#146;s board of directors in identifying a
    Transaction target was that the target business had a management
    team with specialized knowledge of the markets within which it
    operates. Crumbs&#146; senior management team founded the
    business, and its largest investor facilitated the brand&#146;s
    rapid expansion. 57th&#160;Street&#146;s board of directors
    determined Crumbs&#146; management team has requisite knowledge
    and experience within the food and beverage industry, and
    particularly cupcakes, to continue to lead the business as it
    expands.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In addition, 57th&#160;Street&#146;s board of directors also
    gave consideration to the following negative factors (although
    not weighted or in any order of significance):
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <I>Revenues and results of operations are volatile and difficult
    to predict.</I>&#160;&#160;Any number of factors can impact
    Crumbs&#146; revenues and results of operations, causing them to
    fluctuate from quarter to quarter. While Crumbs has control over
    some of these factors, such as the types of baked goods and
    beverages it sells, the independent commercial bakers it
    contracts with to provide services, the retail store locations
    it pursues for new openings and the retail cost of its goods,
    Crumbs has limited to no control over a majority of the factors
    identified by 57th&#160;Street&#146;s board of directors (e.g.
    changes in general market conditions, changes in discretionary
    spending and the impact of nutritional regulations, among
    others).
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <I>Reliance on a small number of
    suppliers.</I>&#160;&#160;Crumbs relies on four primary
    suppliers of its baked goods products and one primary vendor for
    its paper goods and packaging. As of January&#160;19, 2011,
    Crumbs had agreements with four regional bakery suppliers.
    Crumbs&#146; regional suppliers are for the New York, Los
    Angeles, Chicago and Washington,&#160;D.C. area markets.
    Crumbs&#146; exclusive dependence on daily deliveries from only
    four regional suppliers could cause shortages or supply
    interruptions that could adversely impact Crumbs&#146;
    operations. Any increase in distribution prices or failure by
    Crumbs&#146; distributors to perform could adversely affect
    Crumbs&#146; operating results.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    42
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <I>Changing economic and market
    conditions.</I>&#160;&#160;Certain aspects of the business of
    Crumbs are cyclical in nature and based on the current economic
    and market conditions. As a result, Crumbs may be required to
    adjust its sales and marketing practices and react to different
    business opportunities and modes of competition based on the
    economic environment and market opportunities.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <I>Concentration of business.</I>&#160;&#160;Crumbs currently
    operates 24 stores in the Northeast states, of which 14 are
    located in the New York City area, and six stores in California,
    all of which are located in or around the Los Angeles area. As a
    result, Crumbs is particularly susceptible to adverse trends and
    economic conditions in these areas. In addition, given
    Crumbs&#146; geographic concentration, negative publicity
    regarding any of its stores could have a material adverse effect
    on its business and operations, as could other regional
    occurrences impacting the local economies in these markets.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    <I>Barriers to entry and expansion into unfamiliar
    territory.</I>&#160;&#160;Some of Crumbs&#146; new stores are
    planned for markets where it has little or no operating
    experience. Those markets may have different competitive
    conditions, consumer tastes and discretionary spending patterns
    than Crumbs&#146; existing markets. Consumers in a new market
    may not be familiar with the Crumbs brand, and Crumbs may need
    to build brand awareness in that market through greater
    investments in advertising and promotional activity than it
    originally planned. Crumbs may find it more difficult in new
    markets to hire, motivate and keep qualified employees who can
    project its vision. Stores opened in new markets may also have
    lower average store revenue than stores opened in existing
    markets, and may have higher construction, occupancy or
    operating costs than stores in existing markets. Further, Crumbs
    may have difficulty in finding reliable commercial baskets,
    suppliers or distributors that can provide it, either initially
    or over time, with adequate supplies of ingredients meeting its
    quality standards. Revenue at stores opened in new markets may
    not reach expected revenue and profit levels negatively
    impacting overall profitability.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Interest
    of 57th Street Stockholders in the Transaction</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Upon consummation of the Transaction, holders of 57th Street
    Common Shares, including the Sponsor, will own approximately
    73.5% of the Common Shares of 57th Street on a fully diluted
    basis (assuming that no holders of Common Shares elect to tender
    their Common Shares pursuant to this Offer, all Warrants are
    exercised and the Contingency Consideration is not issued), or
    holders of 57th Street will own 13.19% of 57th Street&#146;s
    Common Shares on a fully diluted basis (assuming that holders of
    88% of the Common Shares elect to tender their Common Shares
    pursuant to this Offer, none of the Warrants are exercised, the
    Contingency Consideration is earned and the Sponsor&#146;s
    shares are earned). See &#147;Beneficial Ownership of 57th
    Street Securities.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Certain
    Benefits of 57th Street&#146;s Directors and Officers and Others
    in the Transaction</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    57th Street&#146;s directors and officers have interests in the
    Transaction that are different from, or in addition to, your
    interests as a stockholder. These interests include, among other
    things:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    If 57th Street is unable to consummate the Transaction or fails
    to complete an initial business transaction pursuant to the
    Certificate of Incorporation, we will (i)&#160;cease all
    operations except for the purposes of winding up,
    (ii)&#160;redeem 100% of our public shares of common stock for a
    per share pro rata portion of the Trust&#160;Account (including
    interest, but net of any taxes), subject to the requirements of
    applicable law and (iii)&#160;as promptly as possible following
    such redemption, dissolve and liquidate the balance of our net
    assets to our remaining stockholders. In such event, the 606,256
    founder shares held by the Sponsor that were acquired before the
    IPO for an aggregate purchase price of $25,000 would be
    worthless because the Sponsor is not entitled to receive any of
    the liquidation proceeds with respect to such shares.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The Sponsor purchased an aggregate of 3,500,000 Insider Warrants
    at a purchase price of $0.50 per warrant for an aggregate
    purchase price of $1,750,000 in a private placement prior to the
    IPO. All of the proceeds 57th Street received from this private
    placement were placed in the Trust&#160;Account. The Sponsor has
    agreed to tender all of 3,500,000 Warrants pursuant to the
    Offer. If the Offer is
</TD>
</TR>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->

</TABLE>

    <TD align="left">
    consummated, the Sponsor will receive $3,500,000. If 57th Street
    is unable to consummate the Transaction or fails to complete an
    initial business combination and is subsequently dissolved and
    liquidated, all of 57th Street&#146;s Warrants, including the
    Insider Warrants, will expire worthless. The Insider Warrants

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    It is currently anticipated that Mark D. Klein, our chairman of
    the board of directors and chief executive officer, will be a
    director of 57th Street following the consummation of the
    Transaction.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    If 57th Street liquidates prior to the consummation of a
    business combination, Messrs.&#160;Klein and Lapping will be
    personally liable to pay debts and obligations to vendors and
    other entities that are owed money by 57th&#160;for services
    rendered or products sold to 57th Street, or to any target
    business, to the extent such creditors bring claims that would
    otherwise require payment from monies in the Trust&#160;Account,
    but only if such entities did not execute a waiver (even if such
    waiver is subsequently found to be invalid and unenforceable).
    Based on 57th Street&#146;s estimated debts and obligations, it
    is not currently expected that Messrs.&#160;Klein and Lapping
    will have any exposure under this arrangement in the event of a
    liquidation.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    If 57th Street is required to be liquidated and there are no
    funds remaining to pay the costs associated with the
    implementation and completion of such liquidation,
    Messrs.&#160;Klein and Lapping has agreed to advance 57th Street
    the funds necessary to pay such costs and complete such
    liquidation (currently anticipated to be no more than
    approximately $30,000) and not to seek repayment for such
    expenses.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Additionally, upon consummation of the Transaction, the
    underwriters of 57th Street&#146;s IPO, will be entitled to
    receive approximately $600,193 of deferred underwriting
    commissions, EGS will be entitled to receive $100,000 in
    deferred legal fees, Morgan Joseph will be entitled to receive
    $545,630 in merger and acquisition advisory services, Cynthia
    Lane, LLC will be entitled to receive up to $500,000 as a
    finder&#146;s fee for introducing 57th Street to Crumbs, and TAG
    will be entitled to receive $100,000 (calculated as of the date
    of this Offer to Purchase, which, based on services to be
    performed prior to the Expiration Date, is likely to increase)
    for financial advisory services performed in connection with the
    Transaction.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Anticipated
    Accounting Treatment</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Merger will be accounted for as a recapitalization of Crumbs
    and management has concluded that Crumbs is the accounting
    acquirer based on its evaluation of the facts and circumstances
    of the acquisition. The purpose of the Merger was to assist
    Crumbs with its business plan to expand. Of the two entities,
    Crumbs is the operating entity within the consolidated
    companies. The Members have the right to designate the initial
    board of 57th&#160;Street following the Merger and as holders of
    57th&#160;Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock will have
    the right to appoint a majority of the directors during the
    Earnout Period. Two of Crumbs&#146; continuing board members
    will serve on the 57th Street board of directors. Crumbs&#146;
    senior management will be continuing as senior management of the
    combined company. Although a larger portion of the voting rights
    in the combined entity will be held by former 57th Street
    stockholders, this was not considered determinative, as all
    other important elements considered in determining which party
    has control, including board of directors representation and
    management continuity were not aligned with this voting
    interest. Additionally, the 57th Street stockholders are
    expected to represent a diverse group of stockholders at
    completion of the Merger and we are not aware of any voting or
    other agreements that suggest that they can act as one party.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

    <BR>
    44

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<A name='W81625109'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">THE
    BUSINESS COMBINATION AGREEMENT</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>This section of the Offer to Purchase describes the material
    provisions of the Business Combination Agreement but does not
    purport to describe all of the terms of the Business Combination
    Agreement. The following summary is qualified in its entirety by
    reference to the complete text of the Business Combination
    Agreement, a copy of which is annexed hereto as Annex&#160;I,
    including the amendments thereto, which is incorporated herein
    by reference. Securityholders and other interested parties are
    urged to read the Business Combination Agreement and the
    amendments thereto, copies of which are attached as Annex&#160;I
    hereto, in their entirety because they are the primary legal
    documents that govern the Transaction. Capitalized terms used
    herein and not otherwise defined have the meanings set forth in
    the Business Combination Agreement.</I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>The Business Combination Agreement has been included to
    provide information regarding the terms of the Transaction.
    Except for its status as the contractual document that
    establishes and governs the legal relations among
    57th&#160;Street, Crumbs and Merger Sub, on the one hand, and
    Crumbs and the Members, on the other hand, with respect to the
    Transaction, the Business Combination Agreement is not intended
    to be a source of factual, business or operational information
    about the parties.</I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>The Business Combination Agreement contains representations,
    warranties and covenants that the respective parties made to
    each other as of the date of the Business Combination Agreement
    or other specific dates. The assertions embodied in those
    representations, warranties and covenants were made for purposes
    of the contract among the respective parties and are subject to
    important qualifications and limitations agreed to by the
    parties in connection with negotiating the Business Combination
    Agreement. The representations, warranties and covenants in the
    Business Combination Agreement are also modified in important
    part by the underlying disclosure schedules which are not filed
    publicly and which are subject to a contractual standard of
    materiality different from that generally applicable to
    stockholders and were used for the purpose of allocating risk
    among the parties rather than establishing matters as facts.
    57th&#160;Street and Crumbs do not believe that these schedules
    contain information that is material to an investment
    decision.</I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Structure
    of Transaction</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Pursuant to the Business Combination Agreement,
    57th&#160;Street, Merger Sub, Crumbs and the Members will engage
    in a series of procedural steps as outlined below pursuant to
    which Crumbs will become a non-wholly owned subsidiary of 57th
    Street and the Members will remain members of the Surviving
    Company. Although the following steps are explained in sequence,
    they are anticipated to be accomplished concurrently.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    In connection with the Transaction, the Members, in accordance
    with the terms and conditions of the Business Combination
    Agreement, will receive at the effective time of the Merger the
    Closing Merger Consideration as more fully described below.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    In addition to the Closing Merger Consideration, the Members
    will be entitled to receive, to the extent it becomes due and
    payable in accordance with the terms of the Business Combination
    Agreement the Contingency Consideration upon
    57th&#160;Street&#146;s achievement of certain financial targets
    and stock price targets as more fully described below. The
    Contingency Consideration and the Closing Merger Consideration,
    as adjusted in accordance with the terms of the Business
    Combination Agreement, are referred to as the &#147;Merger
    Consideration&#148;.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Certificates representing the Contingency Consideration and
    certain
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">lock-up</FONT>
    shares (to be used as recourse for indemnity obligations) (the
    &#147;Claim Shares&#148;) will be deposited in escrow and
    subject to an escrow agreement to be entered into at closing.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    57th Street will have completed the Offer pursuant to
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Rule&#160;13e-4</FONT>
    and Regulation&#160;14E (each, as modified, waived or otherwise
    agreed to with the SEC) of the Exchange Act. Through the tender
    offer, stockholders of 57th Street will be provided with the
    opportunity to redeem their Common Shares for cash equal to
    their pro rata share of the aggregate amount then on deposit in
    the Trust&#160;Account, less taxes, upon the consummation of the
    Merger. The obligation of 57th Street to purchase Common Shares
    validly tendered and not properly withdrawn pursuant to the
    Tender Offer will be subject to, among others, the condition
    that no more than a number of shares of the common stock equal
    to 88% of the
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="6%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="92%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Common Shares issued in 57th Street&#146;s IPO have been validly
    tendered and not properly withdrawn pursuant to and prior to the
    expiration of the Tender Offer. In addition, warrantholders of
    57th Street will be provided with the opportunity to redeem
    their Warrants to purchase Common Shares for cash equal to $1.00
    per warrant. Our Sponsor, has agreed to tender all Insider
    Warrants purchased at the time of 57th Street&#146;s IPO.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    At the Effective Time, the Merger Sub shall be merged with and
    into Crumbs by the filing of a certificate of merger with the
    Secretary of State of the State of Delaware. Upon the
    consummation of the Merger, the separate existence of the Merger
    Sub shall thereupon cease and Crumbs, as the surviving company
    in the Merger, shall continue its corporate existence under the
    laws of the State of Delaware as a non-wholly owned subsidiary
    of 57th Street.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Merger
    Consideration to be Delivered</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In connection with the Transaction, the Members, in accordance
    with the terms and conditions of the Business Combination
    Agreement, will receive at the effective time of the Merger
    aggregate consideration consisting of: (A)&#160;$27,000,000 in
    cash (as adjusted, the &#147;Cash Consideration&#148;), and
    (B)&#160;3,900,000 New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units
    and 390,000&#160;shares of Series&#160;A voting preferred stock
    of 57th Street, par value $0.0001 per share, with such terms and
    conditions as set forth in the certificate of designation of
    57th Street (such series the &#147;57th&#160;Street
    Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock&#148; and such shares
    together with such units of New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable
    Units, the &#147;Equity Consideration&#148; and, collectively
    with the Cash Consideration, the &#147;Closing Merger
    Consideration&#148;). Each New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable
    Unit shall be exchangeable, pursuant to the terms of the
    Business Combination Agreement, for one share of common stock of
    57th Street (subject to adjustment pursuant to organic
    anti-dilution provisions in the Business Combination Agreement).
    The Closing Merger Consideration shall be subject to adjustment
    based upon the actual adjusted net working capital of Crumbs as
    of the Closing. The receipt of the Equity Consideration is
    further subject to the execution of lock up agreements (as set
    forth below) by the Members. In addition to the Closing Merger
    Consideration, the Members will be entitled to receive, to the
    extent it becomes due and payable in accordance with the terms
    of the Business Combination Agreement, up to an aggregate of
    4,400,000 New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units and
    440,000&#160;shares of 57th&#160;Street Series&#160;A Voting
    Preferred Stock (the &#147;Contingency Consideration&#148;) upon
    57th&#160;Street&#146;s achievement of certain financial targets
    and stock price targets.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Contingency Consideration is payable pursuant to achievement
    of certain stock price targets based upon the trading price of
    the common stock of 57th Street (&#147;Stock Targets&#148;) and
    financial performance (&#147;EBITDA Targets&#148;), or a
    combination thereof, but will in no event exceed the aggregate
    amount of consideration issuable thereunder. With respect to
    Stock Targets, in the event the common stock of 57th Street
    either (a)&#160;trades at or above $15 for 20 out of 30
    consecutive trading days during the calendar year 2011 (the
    &#147;First Stock Target&#148;), (b)&#160;trades at or above
    $17.50 for 20 out of 30 consecutive trading days during either
    the calendar year 2011 or 2012 (the &#147;Second Stock
    Target&#148;), or (c)&#160;trades at or above $20 for 20 out of
    30 consecutive trading days during any calendar year 2011, 2012
    or 2013 (the &#147;Third Stock Target&#148;), then the Members
    will be entitled to Contingency Consideration equal to
    approximately 1,466,666 New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable
    Units and approximately 146,666&#160;shares of 57th Street
    Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock upon satisfaction of each
    of the First Stock Target, Second Stock Target
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT> Third
    Stock Target. With respect to EBITDA Targets, to the extent that
    not all Stock Targets have been achieved, if 57th Street
    achieves Adjusted EBITDA (as defined below) of $17,500,000 for
    the 12&#160;months ending December&#160;31, 2013 or Adjusted
    EBITDA of $25,000,000 for the 12&#160;months ending
    December&#160;31, 2014, then in each case, the Members shall
    receive 2,200,000 New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units and
    220,000&#160;shares of 57th&#160;Street Series&#160;A Voting
    Preferred Stock. Finally, to the extent any portion of the
    Contingency Consideration has not then been released to the
    Members, in the event 57th Street achieves $30,000,000 in
    Adjusted EBITDA for the 12&#160;months ending December&#160;31,
    2015, such remaining portion of Contingency Consideration will
    be released to the Members.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    For the purposes of the Business Combination Agreement,
    &#147;Adjusted EBITDA&#148; means consolidated net earnings of
    57th Street, including net earnings attributable to any
    non-controlling interest, determined in accordance with United
    States generally accepted accounting principles as of
    January&#160;9, 2011, before interest income or expense, income
    taxes and any gains or losses resulting from the change in
    estimate relating to the
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    46
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Tax Receivable Agreement, depreciation, amortization, losses or
    gains resulting from adjustments to the fair value of the
    contingent consideration, stock-based compensation expense, the
    non-cash effect on rent expense as a result of straight-lining
    rent, extraordinary or non-recurring expenses (including the
    expenses) and all other extraordinary non-cash items for the
    applicable period and as applied on a consistent basis.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Pursuant to the terms and conditions of the Business Combination
    Agreement, the Contingency Consideration or any remaining
    portion thereof shall be released to the Members upon a Change
    of Control (as defined in the Business Combination Agreement) of
    57th Street or the Surviving Company.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Certificates representing the Contingency Consideration and
    certain
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">lock-up</FONT>
    shares (to be used as recourse for indemnity obligations) (the
    &#147;Claim Shares&#148;) will be held in escrow and subject to
    an escrow agreement to be entered into at closing.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    At Closing, 57th&#160;Street, the Surviving Company, Crumbs, the
    Member Representatives and Continental Stock
    Transfer&#160;&#038; Trust&#160;Company (the &#147;Escrow
    Agent&#148;) shall enter into an Escrow Agreement, in the form
    and substance reasonably satisfactory to the Parties (the
    &#147;Escrow Agreement&#148;) and the Surviving Company and
    57th&#160;Street shall deposit with the Escrow Agent pursuant to
    the terms of the Escrow Agreement [A] certificates for 4,400,000
    New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units and
    440,000&#160;shares of 57th&#160;Street Series&#160;A Voting
    Preferred Stock representing the aggregate Contingency
    Consideration payable to the Members pursuant to the Business
    Combination Agreement, and [B] certificates for the Claim
    Shares. The Escrow Agent shall release the relevant portion of
    the Contingency Consideration, if any, 10&#160;days after
    (i)&#160;the relevant determination of the EBITDA Targets for
    the applicable target period, (ii)&#160;the relevant
    determination of the trading prices for the applicable Stock
    Target, or (iii)&#160;the occurrence of a Change of Control of
    57th&#160;Street or Crumbs. To the extent an organic dilution
    event occurs following the date of the Business Combination
    Agreement, but prior to release of all the Contingency
    Consideration from Escrow, 57th&#160;Street and Merger Sub shall
    deposit additional certificates of New Crumbs Class&#160;B
    Exchangeable Units and 57th&#160;Street Series&#160;A Voting
    Shares as may be required pursuant to the Business Combination
    Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    From and after the Effective Time until the earlier of
    (i)&#160;the time when all Contingency Consideration has been
    delivered to the Members after the achievement of any of the
    Stock Targets or EBITDA Targets or (ii)&#160;the expiration of
    the 2015 EBITDA Target (the &#147;Earnout Period&#148;), upon
    the occurrence of a &#147;Change of Control&#148; (as defined
    below) of 57th&#160;Street or Crumbs, the remaining portion of
    the Contingency Consideration shall immediately vest and the
    Members shall be entitled to receive their allocable portions of
    such Contingency Consideration in accordance with the Member
    allocation. For the purposes of the Business Combination
    Agreement, &#147;Permitted Holder&#148; means the Members, their
    Permitted Family Transferees (as defined in the Business
    Combination Agreement) and any other holders of 57th Street
    Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock. For the purposes of the
    Business Combination Agreement, a &#147;Change of Control&#148;
    shall have been deemed to occur with respect to a Person upon:
    (a)&#160;the sale, lease, license, distribution, dividend or
    transfer, license in one or a series of related transactions, of
    50% or more of the Person&#146;s assets; (b)&#160;a merger,
    consolidation or other business combination of such Person or
    any successor or other entity holding all or substantially all
    the assets of such Person that results in the stockholders of
    such Person or other entity holding all or substantially all the
    assets of such Person immediately before the consummation of
    such transaction holding, directly or indirectly, <U>less</U>
    than 50% of the voting power of such Person immediately
    following the consummation of such transaction; (c)&#160;a
    transaction or series of related transactions in which a
    majority of the board of directors or equivalent governing body
    of such Person immediately following or as a proximate cause of
    such transaction is comprised of persons who were not members of
    the board of directors or equivalent governing body of such
    Person immediately prior to such transaction and are not
    designees of the Members; or (d)&#160;any person or
    &#147;group&#148; (within the meaning of
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Rules&#160;13d-3</FONT>
    and <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">13d-5</FONT>
    under the Exchange Act as in effect on the Closing Date) shall
    obtain beneficial ownership (as defined in
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Rules&#160;13d-3</FONT>
    and <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">13d-5</FONT>
    under the Exchange Act) of the voting stock of such Person
    representing more than 35% of the voting power of the capital
    stock of such Person entitled to vote for the election of
    directors of such Person.
</DIV>
