<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In lieu of security deposits required pursuant to the terms of
    several operating leases, Crumbs has chosen to obtain letters of
    credit issued by two financial institutions. As of
    December&#160;31, 2010 and 2009, issued and unused letters of
    credit totaled $529,425 and $580,245, respectively. A base loan
    was issued to Crumbs by one of the financial institutions in
    connection with the letters of credit in the form of a $575,000
    revolving line of credit. Letters of credit amounting to
    $499,425 and $550,245 were reserved under this line of credit as
    of December&#160;31, 2010 and 2009, respectively. The line of
    credit is guaranteed by one of Crumbs&#146; members. The
    remaining $30,000 letter of credit at the second institution is
    secured by a certificate of deposit.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">General
    Economic Trends and Seasonality</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Crumbs results of operations are generally affected by the
    economic trends in its market areas due to the dependence on its
    customers&#146; discretionary spending. Weakness in the national
    or regional economy in Crumbs&#146; market areas, combined with
    other factors including inflation, labor and healthcare costs
    and the availability of suitable locations for future stores,
    may negatively impact its business. If consumer activities
    associated with the use of Crumbs&#146; products decline or the
    business activities of Crumbs&#146; corporate customers
    decrease, its revenues and sales volumes may decline.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    116
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Crumbs&#146; results to date have not been significantly
    impacted by inflation. If Crumbs experiences high inflation in
    labor or leased real estate, it may not be able to pass on all
    of these higher costs to its customers in the short term.
    Although Crumbs believes that it will be able to pass on higher
    costs to its customers over longer periods of time, there can be
    no assurance that Crumbs will be successful in such efforts.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    While Crumbs&#146; business is not highly seasonal, it is
    impacted by weather. Extreme hot and cold weather may cause
    decreased sales in the affected locations and could impact the
    daily delivery of its baked goods. On occasion, severe ice and
    snow conditions have caused Crumbs to close stores during normal
    business hours.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Off-Balance
    Sheet Arrangements</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Crumbs has no off-balance sheet arrangements that have or are
    reasonably likely to have a current or future effect on its
    financial condition, changes in financial condition, revenues or
    expenses, results of operations, liquidity, capital expenditures
    or capital resources.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Critical
    Accounting Policies</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Long-Lived Assets.</I>&#160;&#160;Property and equipment are
    carried at cost and are being depreciated on a straight-line
    basis over their useful lives of 10 to 15&#160;years for
    leasehold improvements and five to 10&#160;years for furniture
    and equipment and three to five years for computer equipment.
    Leasehold improvements are depreciated over the shorter of the
    lease term or the assets useful life. Maintenance and repairs
    are charged to expense as incurred, while capital improvements
    that extend the useful lives of the underlying assets are
    capitalized. Intangible assets include branding costs and
    website design that are amortized over their useful lives,
    estimated to be five years.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Impairment of Long-Lived Assets.</I>&#160;&#160;When facts
    and circumstances indicate that the carrying values of
    long-lived assets may not be recoverable, Crumbs evaluates
    long-lived assets for impairment. Crumbs first compares the
    carrying value of the asset to the asset&#146;s estimated future
    cash flows (undiscounted). If the estimated future cash flows
    are less than the carrying value of the asset, an impairment
    loss is calculated based on the asset&#146;s estimated fair
    value. The fair value of the assets is estimated using a
    discounted cash flow model based on future store revenues and
    operating costs, using internal projections. Property and
    equipment assets are grouped at the lowest level for which there
    are identifiable cash flows when assessing impairment. Cash
    flows for retail assets are identified at the individual store
    level. Long-lived assets to be disposed of are reported at the
    lower of their carrying amount, or fair value less estimated
    costs to sell.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Deferred Rent.</I>&#160;&#160;Crumbs leases retail stores and
    office space under operating leases. Most lease agreements
    contain tenant improvement allowances, rent holidays, lease
    premiums, rent escalation clauses
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    contingent rent provisions. For purposes of recognizing
    incentives, premiums and minimum rental expenses on a
    straight-line basis over the terms of the leases, Crumbs uses
    the date of initial possession to begin amortization, which is
    generally when Crumbs enters the space and begins to make
    improvements.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    For tenant improvement allowances and rent holidays, Crumbs
    records a deferred rent liability in other long-term liabilities
    and amortizes the deferred rent over the terms of the leases as
    reductions to rent expense.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    For scheduled rent escalation clauses during the lease terms or
    for rental payments commencing at a date other than the date of
    initial occupancy, Crumbs records minimum rental expenses on a
    straight-line basis over the terms of the leases.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Revenue Recognition.</I>&#160;&#160;Revenue is recognized
    when payment is tendered at the point of sale. Revenues are
    reported net of sales, use or other transaction taxes that are
    collected from customers and remitted to taxing authorities.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Income Taxes.</I>&#160;&#160;As a partnership for
    U.S.&#160;federal income tax purposes, Crumbs is not subject to
    federal or state income taxes, with the exception of certain LLC
    fees, business entity and composite taxes imposed by certain
    states. Rather, each member in Crumbs is required to report
    separately on its income tax return its distributive share of
    Crumbs&#146; net long-term capital gain or loss, net short term
    capital gain or loss, and net
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    117
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    ordinary income and deductions and credits, in each case, in
    accordance with the allocations to be set forth in Crumbs Third
    Amended&#160;&#038; Restated LLC Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Gift Certificates and Cards.</I>&#160;&#160;In 2009, Crumbs
    stopped issuing gift certificates and replaced them with a gift
    card system. Crumbs has recorded a current liability on the
    balance sheet for outstanding gift certificates and cards.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Recent
    Accounting Pronouncements</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Crumbs has evaluated the recent accounting pronouncements
    through ASU
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">2011-01</FONT> and
    believes that none of them will have a material effect on its
    financial statements, except for the one listed below.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In December 2010, the FASB (Financial Accounting Standards
    Board) issued Accounting Standards Update
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">2010-29</FONT> (ASU
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">2010-29),</FONT>
    Business Combinations (Topic 805): Disclosure of Supplementary
    Pro Forma Information for Business Combinations. The amendments
    in this Update are effective prospectively for business
    combinations for which the acquisition date is on or after the
    beginning of the first annual reporting period beginning on or
    after December&#160;15, 2010. Early application is permitted.
    Crumbs does not expect the provisions of ASU
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">2010-29</FONT> to
    have a material effect on the financial position, results of
    operations or cash flows of Crumbs, however Crumbs may have
    additional disclosure requirements if it completes an
    acquisition.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    118
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

    OF CRUMBS</FONT></B>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Jason Bauer </I>is the co-founder of Crumbs, a member of the
    board of managers and has served as Crumbs&#146; Chief Executive
    Officer since the company was founded in 2003. Prior to
    co-founding Crumbs, Mr.&#160;Bauer was involved in numerous
    entrepreneurial ventures, including founding Famous Fixins, a
    manufacturer of celebrity-licensed products, where he served as
    President and Chief Executive Officer from 1996 through 2002.
    Mr.&#160;Bauer received his BS degree in Marketing and Finance
    from Boston University. Mr.&#160;Bauer is married to Mia Bauer,
    Crumbs&#146; Chief Creative Officer, and Mr.&#160;Bauer&#146;s
    brother, Harley Bauer, serves as Crumbs&#146; Chief Development
    Officer.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Edwin Lewis </I>has served as Crumbs&#146; Chairman of the
    board of managers since March 2008 and is the largest investor
    in Crumbs. Mr.&#160;Lewis served as President and Vice Chairman
    of Mossimo, Inc, from 2002 to 2006 and served previously as
    Mossimo, Inc.&#146;s Chief Executive Officer and President from
    1998 to 2000. Mr.&#160;Lewis was with Tommy Hilfiger, Inc. from
    1990 to 1996, serving as Vice Chairman and Chief Executive
    Officer. Mr.&#160;Lewis also worked for Polo Ralph Lauren from
    1974 through 1990, where he held various positions, including
    Executive Vice President and President of Ralph Lauren
    Womenswear.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>John D. Ireland </I>has served as Crumbs&#146; Chief
    Financial Officer since March 2008. Mr.&#160;Ireland has also
    served as a Member/CPA for Accounting Strategies Group LLC since
    September 2008 and has been the President of ASG, LLC, the
    predecessor entity to Accounting Services Group LLC, since June
    2004. Mr.&#160;Ireland has been a Certified Public Accountant
    since 1985. Mr.&#160;Ireland also has served on the board of
    Provident State Bank since March 2006. Mr.&#160;Ireland received
    his BS degree in Accounting from the University of Maryland and
    received his MS degree in Taxation from Georgetown University.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Mia Bauer </I>is the co-founder of Crumbs and has been
    Crumbs&#146; Chief Creative Officer since the company was
    founded in 2003. Ms.&#160;Bauer is responsible for creating all
    of Crumbs&#146; cupcake recipes. In October 2008, Ms.&#160;Bauer
    published a book called <I>Lolly LaCrumb&#146;s Cupcake
    Adventure </I>that is aimed at children
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">ages&#160;4-6.</FONT>
    Prior to co-founding Crumbs, Ms.&#160;Bauer was a practicing
    attorney and worked in a variety of positions for elected
    officials in New York City. Ms.&#160;Bauer received her BA
    degree in Political Science from Brandeis University and her JD
    from New York Law School. Ms.&#160;Bauer is married to Jason
    Bauer, Crumbs&#146; Chief Executive Officer, and
    Ms.&#160;Bauer&#146;s
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">brother-in-law,</FONT>
    Harley Bauer, serves as Crumbs&#146; Chief Development Officer.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Gary Morrow </I>has served as Crumbs&#146; Vice President of
    Store Operations since May 2010. Prior to joining Crumbs,
    Mr.&#160;Morrow was with Starbucks Coffee Company in various
    positions from November 2000 to April 2010, last serving as
    Category Manager, U.S.&#160;Food for Starbucks Coffee Company,
    where he was responsible for aspects of the company&#146;s food
    program, sales, training and growth strategy. Mr.&#160;Morrow
    received his BS degree in Hotel/Restaurant Management from
    Florida International University.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <I>Harley Bauer </I>has served as Crumbs&#146; Chief Development
    Officer since June 2007. Mr.&#160;Bauer&#146;s duties as Chief
    Development Officer have included implementing a consolidated
    vendor program for all new store
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    119

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    building materials, assisting in site selection, nationalizing
    Crumbs&#146; architecture program, and streamlining the
    permitting process. Before joining Crumbs, Mr.&#160;Bauer worked
    as a film and television producer for Flutie Entertainment from
    June 2002 to April 2007, where he was responsible for budgeting
    of projects and for raising financing for projects.
    Mr.&#160;Bauer&#146;s brother, Jason Bauer, is Crumbs&#146;
    Chief Executive Officer, and Mr.&#160;Bauer&#146;s
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">sister-in-law,</FONT>
    Mia Bauer, serves as Crumbs&#146; Chief Creative Officer.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Executive
    Officer and Board of Manager&#146;s Compensation</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Executive
    Officer Compensation Overview</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Introduction</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    This Compensation Overview provides an overview of Crumbs&#146;
    compensation policies and programs, generally explains
    Crumbs&#146; compensation objectives, policies and practices
    with respect to its executive officers, and identifies the
    elements of compensation for each of the individuals identified
    in the following table, whom Crumbs&#146; refers to in this
    Compensation Overview and the tabular disclosure that follow as
    Crumbs&#146; named executive officers, or &#147;NEOs.&#148;
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B>Name</B>
</DIV>
</TD>

</DIV>

<DIV style="text-indent: -10pt; margin-left: 10pt">
    Harley Bauer
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD align="left" valign="top">
    Chief Development Officer
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Compensation
    and Benefits Philosophy</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Crumbs has designed its compensation and benefits as part of its
    overall human capital management strategy to facilitate its
    ability to attract, retain, reward and motivate a high
    performing executive team. Crumbs&#146; compensation philosophy
    is based on a motivational plan to provide
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">pay-for-performance</FONT>
    (at both the individual and Company levels), to enable
    Crumbs&#146; executive team to achieve Crumbs&#146; objectives
    successfully. Crumbs&#146; motivational plan is designed to
    achieve the following goals:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    To reward principles that effect the success and accomplishment
    of Crumbs&#146; mission and goals;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    To attract, motivate and retain a high performing executive team;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    To recognize and reward individuals whose performance adds
    significant value to Crumbs;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    To support and encourage executive team performance.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Compensation
    Elements</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In 2010, Crumbs&#146; compensation program consisted of the
    following elements:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Base salary;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Long-term incentives (in the form of profits interests);&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Benefits and perquisites.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Crumbs&#146; goal has been to set base compensation ranges at or
    above market (10% or more) and to add competitive benefits as
    Crumbs is able.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In 2011, to emphasize the relationship between executive pay and
    Crumbs&#146; performance, Crumbs has added what it refers to as
    a &#147;performance management system&#148; that includes
    performance-based pay and an organizational bonus that ties
    individual performance to Crumbs&#146; success. Crumbs&#146; new
    performance management system is part of its human capital
    strategic plan to grow the organization by investing in its
    human resources, to be a performance-based company, and to
    ensure that Crumbs has the leadership and talent necessary to
    successfully meet its future challenges. Ultimately, Crumbs
    strives to be an &#147;employer of choice&#148; in its market
    and industry. To accomplish this, Crumbs recognizes that it must
    be competitive in the marketplace.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    120
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

</DIV>

    Crumbs&#146; NEOs for the year ended December&#160;31, 2010:

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (1) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Because Crumbs is not a reporting company, Crumbs has reported
    compensation information for 2010 only.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (2) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Crumbs did not maintain a bonus plan during 2010. While
    Crumbs&#146; NEOs may receive bonuses with respect to their 2010
    performance, no such bonuses have been paid to date and no NEO
    has any entitlement to a bonus for 2010.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (3) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Crumbs did not maintain an equity compensation plan during 2010
    and did not grant any stock awards or option awards in 2010.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (4) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Crumbs did not maintain a non-equity incentive plan during 2010.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (5) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Amounts reported in this column for Mr.&#160;J. Bauer consisted
    of a car lease and car insurance payments, reimbursement of the
    cost of gasoline and car maintenance, and cell phone payments
    for business and personal calls. Amounts reported in this column
    for Mr.&#160;H. Bauer consisted of apartment rental and parking
    payments and reimbursement of the cost of gasoline during his
    temporary assignment to attend to Crumbs&#146; operations in
    Chicago, and cell phone payments for business and personal calls.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Employment
    Agreements</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Crumbs entered into an employment agreement with Mr.&#160;Jason
    Bauer on March&#160;6, 2008, and a subscription and employment
    agreement with Mr.&#160;Ireland on September&#160;30, 2008.
    Crumbs has not entered into an employment agreement with
    Mr.&#160;Harley Bauer. Under their employment agreements,
    Mr.&#160;J. Bauer is entitled to an annualized salary of
    $500,000, and Mr.&#160;Ireland is entitled to an annualized
    salary of $175,000. However, Crumbs has subsequently increased
    the base salary for Mr.&#160;J. Bauer to $700,000 and the base
    salary for Mr.&#160;Ireland to $210,000. Mr.&#160;Ireland&#146;s
    subscription and employment agreement also entitled
    Mr.&#160;Ireland to receive 15,385 Class&#160;B membership
    interests, referred to as &#147;Class&#160;B Interests,&#148; on
    September&#160;30, 2008. Each of Messrs.&#160;J. Bauer and
    Ireland is entitled to participate in Crumbs&#146; health and
    other employee benefit plans, although Mr.&#160;Ireland does not
    currently participate in Crumbs&#146; health plan.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The employment agreement for each of Messrs.&#160;J. Bauer and
    Mr.&#160;Ireland provides that upon termination of employment
    his right to receive any form of compensation from Crumbs will
    cease, and Crumbs will have no obligation to pay severance or
    any other benefit except for benefits required by law and any
    reimbursement for expenses not yet reimbursed.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Mr.&#160;Ireland&#146;s subscription and employment agreement
    provides further that if Crumbs terminates his employment for
    cause (as defined below) or if he voluntarily terminates his
    employment, he will forfeit all of his Class&#160;B Interests.
    However, Mr.&#160;Ireland will not forfeit his Class&#160;B
    Interests upon his death, disability (as defined below), or
    retirement at the age of 62, or if Crumbs terminates his
    employment without cause.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Mr.&#160;Ireland&#146;s agreement defines &#147;disability&#148;
    for this purpose as his inability, due to physical or mental
    illness or incapacity, to fulfill his duties to Crumbs, as
    determined by a board certified physician chosen in the
    reasonable discretion of Crumbs, for a period of 90 consecutive
    days or 120 non-consecutive days in any consecutive
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">12-month</FONT>
    period.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    121
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Mr.&#160;Ireland&#146;s agreement defines &#147;cause&#148; as
    (1)&#160;failure to follow the reasonable direction of
    Crumbs&#146; board of directors, unless such failure is cured
    within 10&#160;days after written notice of the failure;
    (2)&#160;commission of any act of fraud, willful
    misrepresentation, misappropriation, embezzlement, or any act of
    similar gravity involving moral turpitude, or willful damage of
    or to any of Crumbs&#146; property as determined by Crumbs in
    its sole discretion; (3)&#160;a conviction or plea of guilty or
    no contest to a felony involving moral turpitude or resulting in
    incarceration; and (4)&#160;commission of any act of gross
    negligence, willful malfeasance, reckless nonfeasance or
    malfeasance or any willful violation of law, in the performance
    of Mr.&#160;Ireland&#146;s duties to Crumbs or its affiliates.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">2010
    Outstanding Equity Awards At Fiscal Year-End</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    outstanding for Crumbs&#146; NEOs as of December&#160;31, 2010:

    <TD width="97%"></TD>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (1) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Crumbs issued 15,385 Class&#160;B Interests to Mr.&#160;Ireland
    upon his execution of his subscription and employment agreement
    with Crumbs dated September&#160;30, 2008. Mr.&#160;Ireland will
    forfeit all of his Class&#160;B Interests if Crumbs terminates
    his employment at any time for cause or if he voluntarily
    terminates his employment, other than upon his retirement at
    age&#160;62. These terms are described more fully in the
    narrative under the heading &#147;Employment Agreements&#148;
    accompanying the &#147;Summary Compensation Table,&#148; above.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Retirement
    Plans; Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation Plans</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Crumbs currently does not maintain any retirement or
    non-qualified deferred compensation plans for any of its
    employees that provide for the payment of retirement benefits or
    benefits that will be paid primarily following retirement.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Termination
    or Change in Control Benefits</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In the event of termination, Messrs.&#160;J. Bauer, Ireland, and
    H. Bauer would receive no additional benefits beyond those
    required to be provided by law and any reimbursement of ordinary
    business expenses incurred to the date of termination. However,
    if Crumbs terminates Mr.&#160;Ireland without cause or he
    terminates employment due to his death, disability or retirement
    at age&#160;62, he will be entitled to retain all of his
    Class&#160;B Interests. None of Crumbs&#146; NEOs is entitled to
    any additional benefits in the event of a change in control of
    Crumbs.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Board Of
    Managers Compensation</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Crumbs&#146; board of managers is comprised of
    Messrs.&#160;Jason Bauer and Edwin Lewis, neither of whom
    receive any compensation in their capacity as members of
    Crumbs&#146; board of managers.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    122
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<A name='W81625120'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">UNAUDITED
    PRO FORMA CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL INFORMATION</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The following unaudited pro forma consolidated statements of
    balance sheet as of December&#160;31, 2010 and the unaudited
    consolidated statement of operations for the year ended
    December&#160;31, 2010 are based on the separate historical
    financial statements of Crumbs Holdings LLC and its subsidiaries
    (&#147;Crumbs&#148;) and 57th Street General Acquisition Corp.
    (&#147;57th Street&#148;) after giving effect to the Merger and
    the Offer. The unaudited pro forma consolidated financial
    information has been revised to reflect the terms of the
    &#147;Business Combination Agreement&#148;.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The unaudited pro forma consolidated financial information is
    included for informational purposes only and does not purport to
    reflect the results of operations or financial position of 57th
    Street that would have occurred had we operated as a
    consolidated entity for the periods presented. The unaudited pro
    forma consolidated financial information should not be relied
    upon as being indicative of our results of operations or
    financial position had the &#147;Business Combination
    Agreement&#148; occurred on the dates assumed. The unaudited pro
    forma consolidated financial information also does not project
    our results of operations or financial position for any future
    period or date.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On January&#160;9, 2011, 57th Street entered into a Business
    Combination Agreement (as it may be amended from time to time,
    the &#147;Business Combination Agreement&#148;) with Crumbs
    Holdings LLC, the members of Crumbs (&#147;Members&#148;) and
    the representatives of Crumbs and the Members, which was
    subsequently amended on February&#160;18, 2011, pursuant to
    which a subsidiary of 57th&#160;Street would merge with and into
    Crumbs, with Crumbs surviving as a non-wholly-owned subsidiary
    of 57th&#160;Street (the &#147;Merger&#148;). The Merger will be
    accounted for as a recapitalization of Crumbs and management has
    concluded that Crumbs is the accounting acquirer based on its
    evaluation of the facts and circumstances of the acquisition.
    The purpose of the Merger was to assist Crumbs with its business
    plan to expand. Of the two entities, Crumbs is the operating
    entity within the consolidated companies. The Members have the
    right to designate the initial board of 57th Street following
    the Merger and as holders of 57th Street Series&#160;A Voting
    Preferred Stock (as defined below) will have the right to
    appoint a majority of the directors during the Earnout Period.
    Two of Crumbs&#146; continuing board members will continue to
    serve on the 57th Street board of directors. Crumbs&#146; senior
    management will be continuing as senior management of the
    combined company. Although a larger portion of the voting rights
    in the combined entity will be held by former 57th Street
    stockholders, this was not considered determinative, as all
    other important elements considered in determining which party
    has control, including board of directors representation and
    management continuity were not aligned with this voting
    interest. Additionally, the 57th Street stockholders are
    expected to represent a diverse group of stockholders at
    completion of the Merger and we are not aware of any voting or
    other agreements that suggest that they can act as one party.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The pro forma adjustments principally give effect to:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    The recapitalization of Crumbs with the net proceeds of this
    business combination and the related effects of the Tax
    Receivable Agreement. See &#147;The Related
    Agreements&#160;&#151; Tax Receivable Agreement.&#148;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    3,900,000 newly issued Class&#160;B units of Crumbs (the
    &#147;New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units&#148;), which
    shall be exchangeable for 3,900,000 Common Shares (subject to
    certain adjustments related to organic dilution) at the request
    from time to time of any holder of any such New Crumbs
    Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units pursuant to the terms of an
    Exchange and Support Agreement between the Member, Crumbs and
    57th Street. See &#147;The Related Agreements&#148; for more
    information about the Exchange and Support Agreement.
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    390,000&#160;shares of Series&#160;A voting preferred stock of
    57th Street, par value $0.0001 per share (such series the
    &#147;57th Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock&#148;),
    which shall among other things entitle the holders of such
    shares of 57th Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock the
    right to vote 10 votes per share in all matters for which the
    Common Shares are entitled to vote and provide the holder of
    such 57th Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock voting as
    a class the right to appoint a majority of the our board of
    directors, during the &#147;Earn-out Period&#148; as further
    described below. Shares of 57th Street
</TD>
</TR>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->

</TABLE>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    123
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="6%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="92%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock will be proportionately
    redeemed upon exchange of shares of New Crumbs Class&#160;B
    Exchangeable Units
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    See &#147;Description of Securities&#148; for more information
    about the terms of the
    57<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">th</SUP>

    Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The 3,900,000 New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units and
    390,000 57th Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock
    (together referred herein as the &#147;Equity
    Consideration&#148;) combined will, subject to certain
    preferential rights, approximate the voting, economic and other
    rights the Members would have, were they to hold 3,900,000
    Common Shares, representing 25.21% of the outstanding Common
    Shares of 57th&#160;Street after giving effect to the Merger and
    the issuance of the Equity Consideration and assuming no
    Contingency Consideration (as defined below) is issued, no
    Common Shares are tendered in the Offer, no Warrants are
    exercised and no securities are issued pursuant to the Incentive
    Plan (as defined in the Business Combination Agreement).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    In addition, the Members will be entitled to receive the
    following additional consideration in exchange for their Old
    Crumbs Units upon either the achievement of certain financial
    targets and stock price targets during the period beginning
    after the Closing and ending on December&#160;31, 2015 (such
    period referred to as the &#147;Earnout Period&#148;) or upon
    the occurrence of certain acceleration events:
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="6%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="92%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Up to 4,400,000 New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable
    Units&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    Up to 440,000&#160;shares of 57th&#160;Street Series&#160;A
    Voting Preferred Stock.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The 4,400,000 New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units and
    440,000 57th Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock
    (together referred herein as the &#147;Contingency
    Consideration&#148;) combined will, subject to certain
    preferential rights, approximate the voting, economic and other
    rights the Members would have, were they to hold 4,400,000
    Common Shares, when aggregated with the Equity Consideration,
    would represent 41.46% of the outstanding Common Shares after
    giving effect to the Merger and the issuance of the Equity
    Consideration and Contingency Consideration and assuming no
    Common Shares are tendered in the Offer, no Warrants are
    exercised and no securities are issued pursuant to the Incentive
    Plan. See &#147;The Business Combination Agreement&#160;&#151;
    Merger Consideration to be Delivered&#148; for a further
    description of the Contingency Consideration.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 4%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The effect of this additional contingent consideration was not
    addressed in the pro forma presentation as the New Crumbs
    Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units and related 57th&#160;Street
    Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock have not been earned as of
    the dates being presented and the issuance of the New Crumbs
    Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units Exchangeable Units will be
    issued to the accounting acquirer and be treated similarly to a
    stock dividend. If the contingencies are met, the future
    issuance of these New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units and
    57th&#160;Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock will have
    a dilutive effect on the current shareholders of 57th Street.
</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (1) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Reflects reduction in non-recurring deal expenses of $161,500
    associated with the Merger, incurred by
    57<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">th</SUP>

    Street.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (2) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Following the Merger, we will be subject to U.S. federal income
    taxes, in addition to state and local taxes, with respect to our
    allocable share of any net taxable income of Crumbs, which will
    result in higher income taxes. As a result, the pro forma
    statements of income reflect an adjustment to our provision for
    corporate income taxes to reflect an effective rate of 40%,
    which includes provision for U.S. federal income taxes and
    assumes the highest statutory rates apportioned to each state
    and local jurisdiction.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (3) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    As described in the &#147;Business Combination Agreement&#148;
    57<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">th</SUP>

    Street has become the sole member of Crumbs holding
    Series&#160;A Voting Units with the power to appoint its board
    of managers.
    57<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">th</SUP>

    Street will initially own less then 100% of the economic
    interest in Crumbs Holdings LLC, but will have 100% of the
    voting power on ordinary matters and control the management of
    Crumbs. Immediately following this offering, the non-controlling
    interest will be 39.74%, excluding the 150,000 Sponsor shares
    which are held in escrow. Net income attributable to the
    non-controlling interest represents $220,921 of income before
    income taxes of $555,916.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

    a trust account and transfer to cash and cash equivalents of
    $54,494,749 (see note&#160;3)&#160;offset by the payment of
    $27,000,000 as cash consideration for the Merger to the former
    members of Crumbs, the payment of deal expenses of $4,617,083
    and the tender of the Insider Warrants issued to our Sponsor and
    underwriter of our IPO for an aggregate of $3,700,000.</TD>
</TR>

    paid-in capital.</TD>

<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

    <TD align="right" valign="top">

    <TD></TD>

    a trust account and transfer to cash and cash equivalents (see
    note&#160;1).</TD>
</TR>

    <TD align="right" valign="top">

    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Reflects adjustments to give effect to the Tax Receivable
    Agreement based on the following assumptions:</TD>
</TR>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    <TD width="5%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    &#149; </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    we will record an increase of $11,149,000 in deferred tax assets
    for estimated income tax effects of the increase in the tax
    basis of the purchased interests and future projected payments
    under the Tax Receivable Agreement, based on an effective income
    tax rate of 40% (which includes a provision for U.S. federal,
    state and local income taxes);</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    &#149; </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    we will record $5,575,000, representing 50% of the estimated
    realizable tax benefit resulting from (i)&#160;the tax basis in
    the intangible assets of Crumbs on the date of the offering,
    (ii)&#160;the increase in the tax basis of the purchased
    interests as noted above and (iii)&#160;certain other tax
    benefits related to entering into the Tax Receivable Agreement
    as an increase to the liability due to existing owners under the
    Tax Receivable Agreement;</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    &#149; </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    we will record an increase to additional paid-in capital of
    $5,575,000, which is an amount equal to the difference between
    the increase in deferred tax assets and the increase in
    liability due to existing owners under the Tax Receivable
    Agreement; and</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    &#149; </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    there was no effect given to the future exchange of New Crumbs
    Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units into Common Shares, if this
    event occurs there will be an increase to the deferred tax asset
    and potentially an increase in the payable to related parties
    pursuant to the Tax Receivable Agreement. In addition, upon
    exchange of the New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units, the
    non-controlling interest percentage would be reduced as the
    exchanging party would become a common stockholder of 57th
    Street General Acquisition; and,</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    &#149; </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    there are no material changes in the relevant tax law and that
    we earn sufficient taxable income in each year to realize the
    full tax benefit of the amortization of our assets.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (12) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    A reclassification of historical accumulated losses of 57th
    Street (see note&#160;11).</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (13) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    As described in the &#147;Business Combination Agreement,&#148;
    57th Street has become the sole member of Crumbs holding
    Series&#160;A Voting Units with the power to appoint its board
    of managers. 57th Street will initially have 100% of the voting
    power on ordinary matters and control the management of Crumbs.
    As a result, we will consolidate the financial results of Crumbs
    and will record non-controlling interest on our balance sheet.
    Immediately following the Merger, the non-controlling interest,
    based on the assumptions to the pro forma financial information,
    will be $10,422,000. Pro forma non-controlling interest
    represents 39.74% of the pro forma equity of Crumbs Holdings LLC
    of $26,221,289, which differs from the pro forma equity of
    57<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">th</SUP>

    Street as the former is not affected by the adjustments relating
    to the Tax Receivable Agreement described above in note&#160;4.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (14) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    This amount represents the full repurchase of the remaining
    5,456,300 outstanding warrants from the public warrant holders
    and the deferral of merger expenses in the amount of $1,196,699
    to maintain a minimum of $16,000,000 in cash and cash
    equivalents per the Business Combination Agreement.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (15) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    To reduce additional paid-in capital by $3,287,300 for the
    repurchase of the remaining warrants from the non-insider public
    stockholders and the deferral of merger expenses described in
    note&#160;14 and by the non-controlling interest adjustment as
    calculated in note&#160;16 below.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (16) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    To adjust the 39.74% non-controlling interest in the amount of
    $2,169,000 as a result from the full repurchase of the remaining
    5,456,300 outstanding warrants from the non-insider public
    stockholders as described in note&#160;14.</TD>
</TR>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<A name='W81625121'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">MANAGEMENT
    OF 57<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">TH</SUP>

    STREET FOLLOWING THE TRANSACTION</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Directors
    and Executive Officers</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Pursuant to the terms of the Business Combination Agreement, to
    the extent that no amendment to our Certificate of Incorporation
    or any stockholder vote shall be required, 57th&#160;Street
    shall take all necessary action, including causing directors to
    resign, so that five persons to be designated by the Members,
    (at least two of whom shall be independent under the applicable
    rules of the SEC and the applicable stock exchange), are
    appointed or elected, as applicable, to the positions of
    directors of 57th&#160;Street in classes as designated by the
    Members to serve in such positions as of the Closing and such
    directors shall constitute the entire board, and so that persons
    to be designated by the Members are appointed or elected, as
    applicable, to the positions of officers of 57th&#160;Street and
    to serve in such positions as of the Effective Time. Immediately
    following the consummation of the Transaction, 57th
    Street&#146;s directors and executive officers are expected to
    be as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
