<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    See &#147;Management of Crumbs&#148; for biographical
    information of Jason and Mia Bauer, Mr.&#160;Lewis,
    Mr.&#160;Ireland, Mr.&#160;Morrow and Harley Bauer. See
    &#147;Management of 57th&#160;Street&#148; for biographical
    information of Mr.&#160;Klein.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The remaining two directors who shall serve on the initial board
    of directors of 57th Street following the completion of the
    Merger have not yet been identified. The Members have the right
    to designate such directors prior to the completion of the
    Merger.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Classes
    of Directors</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Although 57th Street&#146;s board of directors is divided into
    two classes having staggered three-year terms, such that the
    term of one class expires at each annual meeting of
    stockholders, pursuant to the Certificate of Incorporation, 57th
    Street is not required to maintain these classes of directors
    following the consummation of its business transaction. It is
    expected that, following the consummation of the Transaction,
    the board of directors will consider whether to submit to
    stockholders an amendment to the Certificate of Incorporation to
    provide for a staggered board.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Committees
    of the Board of Directors</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The members of the committees of 57th&#160;Street&#146;s board
    of directors will not be appointed until 57th&#160;Street&#146;s
    board of directors is fully reconstituted and holds its initial
    meeting following consummation of the Transaction. At that time,
    57th&#160;Street&#146;s board of directors will make
    determinations with respect to each committee member&#146;s
    independence in accordance with the NASDAQ Capital Market
    listing standards and SEC rules and regulations and each
    committee will adopt its committee charter.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Following the consummation of the Transaction, 57th&#160;Street
    intends to post the committee charters on its website at
    www.crumbs.com.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Audit
    Committee</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Audit Committee will be at all times composed of exclusively
    independent directors who are &#147;financially literate,&#148;
    meaning they are able to read and understand fundamental
    financial statements, including 57th&#160;Street&#146;s balance
    sheet, income statement and cash flow statement. In addition,
    the Audit Committee will
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    129
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    have at least one member who qualifies as an &#147;audit
    committee financial expert&#148; as defined in rules and
    regulations of the SEC. Immediately following the consummation
    of the Transaction, 57th&#160;Street&#146;s board of directors
    will also make determinations regarding the financial literacy
    and financial expertise of each member of the Audit Committee in
    accordance with the NASDAQ Capital Market listing standards and
    SEC rules.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The principal duties and responsibilities of
    57th&#160;Street&#146;s Audit Committee will be to engage
    57th&#160;Street&#146;s independent auditors, oversee the
    quality and integrity of 57th&#160;Street&#146;s financial
    reporting and the audit of 57th&#160;Street&#146;s financial
    statements by its independent auditors and in fulfilling its
    obligations, 57th&#160;Street&#146;s Audit Committee will review
    with 57th&#160;Street&#146;s management and independent auditors
    the scope and result of the annual audit, the auditors&#146;
    independence and 57th&#160;Street&#146;s accounting policies.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The Audit Committee will be required to report regularly to
    57th&#160;Street&#146;s board of directors to discuss any issues
    that arise with respect to the quality or integrity of
    57th&#160;Street&#146;s financial statements, its compliance
    with legal or regulatory requirements, the performance and
    independence of 57th&#160;Street&#146;s independent auditors, or
    the performance of the internal audit function. After the
    consummation of the Transaction, the board of directors intends
    to adopt a written charter for the Audit Committee.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Compensation
    Committee</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The compensation committee will be at all times composed of
    exclusively independent directors. Among other functions, the
    compensation committee will oversee the compensation of
    57th&#160;Street&#146;s chief executive officer and other
    executive officers and senior management, including plans and
    programs relating to cash compensation, incentive compensation,
    equity-based awards and other benefits and perquisites and
    administers any such plans or programs as required by the terms
    thereof.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Compensation
    Committee Interlocks and Insider Participation</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    57th&#160;Street will disclose which, if any, members appointed
    to the compensation committee have had any relationships with
    57th&#160;Street of the type required to be disclosed by
    Item&#160;404 of
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Regulation&#160;S-K</FONT>
    of the SEC rules and regulations following consummation of the
    Transaction and reconstituting the board of directors. None of
    the individuals who will be an executive officer of
    57th&#160;Street following the consummation of the Transaction
    has served as a member of the board of directors, or as a member
    of the compensation or similar committee, of any entity that has
    one or more executive officers who will serve on
    57th&#160;Street&#146;s board of directors immediately following
    the Transaction.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Corporate
    Governance Committee</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The corporate governance committee will be at all times composed
    of exclusively independent directors. The principal duties and
    responsibilities of 57th&#160;Street&#146;s corporate governance
    committee will be to identify qualified individuals to become
    board members, recommend to the board of directors individuals
    to be designated as nominees for election as directors at the
    annual meetings of stockholders, and develop and recommend to
    the board of directors 57th&#160;Street&#146;s corporate
    governance guidelines.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Once the final director designees have been identified the board
    of directors will identify which members of the board of
    directors will serve on the corporate governance committee.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Code of
    Conduct and Ethics</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    57th&#160;Street has adopted a code of conduct and ethics
    applicable to its executive officers, directors and employees,
    its subsidiaries and its controlled affiliates in accordance
    with applicable federal securities laws. Following the
    consummation of the Transaction, 57th&#160;Street intends to
    post its code of ethics on its website at www.crumbs.com and to
    post any amendments to or any waivers from a provision of its
    code of ethics on such website.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    130
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Director
    Compensation</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Crumbs is currently evaluating the compensation that 57th Street
    will provide for its directors and will determine that
    compensation following consummation of the Merger.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Executive
    Compensation</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Crumbs is currently reevaluating the executive compensation
    structures and systems that 57th&#160;Street will provide for
    its named executive officers, with attention to instituting
    equity awards under an incentive stock option plan, as required
    by the Business Combination Agreement, benchmarking compensation
    through the use of surveys and the services of an outside
    consultant, and revising its cash and bonus programs to base
    awards on market data and performance goals, with attention to
    encouraging long-term sustained performance.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Employment
    Agreements</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In connection with the consummation of the Transaction,
    57th&#160;Street intends to enter into employment agreements
    with Jason Bauer, Mia Bauer and John D. Ireland. The terms and
    conditions of those agreements are generally as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Under the terms and conditions of his employment agreement,
    Jason Bauer will be employed as the Chief Executive Officer of
    57th Street commencing on the consummation of the Transaction
    and ending on December&#160;31, 2015 unless sooner terminated
    pursuant to the provisions of the agreement.
    Mr.&#160;Bauer&#146;s compensation includes an initial annual
    base salary of $700,000 and participation in 57th Street&#146;s
    performance based bonus program as may be established by 57th
    Street. Mr.&#160;Bauer will be also entitled to the use of a
    luxury automobile of his choosing with a monthly lease value not
    to exceed $1,300 during the term of the agreement. Subject to
    the execution and non-revocation of a release, Mr.&#160;Bauer
    will be entitled to a severance payment equal to 18&#160;months
    of his then current annual base salary and payment of his COBRA
    premiums for 18&#160;months in the event Mr.&#160;Bauer is
    terminated by 57th Street without cause or Mr.&#160;Bauer
    terminates for good reason. For purposes of the agreement,
    &#147;cause&#148; generally means (i)&#160;the continuing and
    substantial willful failure, neglect or refusal to perform
    duties, (ii)&#160;the commission of fraud or embezzlement,
    (iii)&#160;the breach of non-solicitation, non-compete and
    confidentiality provisions of the agreement, (iv)&#160;the
    conviction of or pleading nolo contendere to a felony, which has
    not been cured within 10 business days of written notice of the
    breach or (v)&#160;alcohol or substance abuse which materially
    affects his abilities to perform his duties. For purposes of the
    agreement, &#147;good reason&#148; generally means (i)&#160;the
    failure by 57th Street to fulfill its obligations under the
    agreement, (ii)&#160;a material adverse change to or reduction
    of Mr.&#160;Bauer&#146;s duties and responsibilities,
    (iii)&#160;a reduction in base salary, (iv)&#160;the relocation
    of Mr.&#160;Bauer&#146;s office to a location more than
    35&#160;miles from 57th Street&#146;s current headquarters, or
    (v)&#160;a change of control. For purposes of the agreement, a
    &#147;change of control&#148; generally means (i)&#160;the sale,
    lease, exchange or transfer of all of the assets of 57th Street,
    (ii)&#160;the acquisition by any person (as defined by the
    Securities Exchange Act of 1934)&#160;of beneficial ownership of
    57th Street that represents more than 50% of the combined voting
    power of 57th Street&#146;s currently outstanding voting
    securities, (iii)&#160;if during a period of 2 consecutive
    years, the individuals who at the beginning of such period
    constituted the board of directors of 57th Street (or their
    nominees) cease for any reason to constitute a majority of the
    board of directors, (iv)&#160;57th Street consummates a merger,
    amalgamation or consolidation whereby the beneficial owners of
    57th Street common stock and voting stock immediately
    outstanding prior to such consummation own less than 50% of the
    common stock or voting securities of the resulting entity. The
    agreement includes a provision whereby Mr.&#160;Bauer may not
    compete with the business of 57th Street or solicit any of 57th
    Street&#146;s employees, vendors or business partners during the
    term of the agreement and for a period of 18&#160;months after
    the termination of his employment (or 12&#160;months if
    termination is due to non-renewal of the agreement). The
    agreement also includes provisions whereby Mr.&#160;Bauer is
    obligated to keep 57th Street&#146;s proprietary and
    confidential information secret. The agreement provides that
    57th Street will indemnify Mr.&#160;Bauer from and against any
    loss or action arising out of the discharging of his duties
    under the agreement unless due to his bad faith or willful
    misconduct.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The terms of Mia Bauer&#146;s employment agreement are generally
    similar to Mr.&#160;Bauer&#146;s agreement except that
    (i)&#160;she will be employed as the Chief Creative Officer of
    57th Street commencing on the consummation
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    131
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    of the Transaction and ending December&#160;31, 2013 unless
    sooner terminated pursuant to the provisions of the agreement,
    (ii)&#160;Mrs.&#160;Bauer&#146;s initial annual base salary will
    be $250,000, and (iii)&#160;she is not entitled to the use of an
    automobile.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The terms of Chuck Ireland&#146;s employment agreement are
    generally similar to Mr.&#160;Bauer&#146;s agreement except that
    (i)&#160;he will be employed as the Chief Financial Officer of
    57th Street commencing on the consummation of the Transaction
    and ending December&#160;31, 2013 unless sooner terminated
    pursuant to the provisions of the agreement,
    (ii)&#160;Mr.&#160;Ireland&#146;s initial annual base salary
    will be $325,000, and (iii)&#160;he is not entitled to the use
    of an automobile.
</DIV>

<A name='W81625122'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">BENEFICIAL
    OWNERSHIP OF
    57<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">TH</SUP>

    STREET SECURITIES</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The following table sets forth information known to us regarding
    the beneficial ownership of the Common Shares as of
    February&#160;7, 2011 (pre-Transaction) and the beneficial
    ownership of the Common Shares and the 57th Street Series&#160;A
    Voting Preferred Stock immediately following consummation of the
    Transaction (post-Transaction) by:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="4%"></TD>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="94%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    each person known by us to be the beneficial owner of more than
    5% of the outstanding Common Shares on February&#160;7, 2011
    (pre-Transaction) and of our Common Shares and Series&#160;A
    Voting Preferred Stock outstanding after the consummation of the
    Transaction (post-Transaction);
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    each of our current officers and directors;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    each person who will become an executive officer or director
    upon consummation of the Transaction;
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    all pre-Transaction executive officers and directors as a
    group;&#160;and
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 6pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>    &#149;&#160;
</TD>
    <TD align="left">
    all post-Transaction executive officers and directors as a group.
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    As of February&#160;7, 2011, 57th Street had 6,062,556 Common
    Shares issued and outstanding and no outstanding preferred stock.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Unless otherwise indicated, we believe that all persons named in
    the table below have sole voting and investment power with
    respect to all securities that they beneficially own (within the
    meaning of
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Rule&#160;13d-3</FONT>
    of the Exchange Act).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Information (pre-Transaction) does not reflect beneficial
    ownership of our outstanding Warrants as these Warrants are not
    currently exercisable.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Information (post-Transaction) with respect to our Common
    Shares: (i)&#160;does not reflect beneficial ownership of the
    Common Shares underlying 4,400,000 New Crumbs Class&#160;B
    Exchangeable Units issuable as contingency consideration in
    connection with the Merger and held in escrow on behalf of the
    Members which are only issuable upon the attainment of certain
    stock certain financial and stock price targets that have not
    been met yet, (ii)&#160;does not reflect the possible forfeiture
    of up to 150,000 Common Shares by our pre-Transaction executive
    officers and directors as a result of us not meeting certain
    financial and stock price targets post-Transaction because our
    executive officers and directors retain their ability to vote
    such shares; however, such shares will remain in escrow until
    earned or forfeited, (iii)&#160;reflects the tender of 3,500,000
    (or 100%) of the Warrants owned by our Sponsor,
    (iv)&#160;assumes the conversion of 3,900,000 New Crumbs
    Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units issued in connection with the
    consummation of the Transaction to the Members into 3,900,000
    Common Shares immediately upon consummation of the Transaction
    (and the corresponding cancellation of 390,000&#160;shares of
    57th&#160;Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock),
    (v)&#160;assumes that no stockholders tender their Common Shares
    for redemption and (vi)&#160;assumes no tender and full exercise
    of 5,656.300 Warrants, as such Warrants are exercisable within
    60&#160;days following the consummation of the Transaction.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Additionally, information (post-Transaction) with respect to the
    57th Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock: (i)&#160;does
    not reflect beneficial ownership of the 440,000&#160;shares of
    57th Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock issuable as
    Contingency Consideration in connection with the Merger and held
    in escrow on behalf of
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    132
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    the Members which are only issuable upon attainment of certain
    stock price targets that have not been met yet; and
    (ii)&#160;assumes the 3,900,000 New Crumbs Class&#160;B
    Exchangeable Units issued in connection with the consummation of
    the Transaction to the Members have not been converted into
    Common Shares.
</DIV>

    power over our Sponsor and, as a result, Mr.&#160;Lapping may be
    considered the beneficial owner of any shares owned by the
    Sponsor. The members of the Sponsor are Mark D. Klein, Jakal
    Investments LLC, an entity controlled by Mr.&#160;Lapping,
    Frederick G. Kraegel, Leonard A. Potter, Andrew A. Fink and
    Michael Gross and 57th Street Partners LLC, whose sole managing
    members are Mr.&#160;Levitt and Mr.&#160;Berger.</TD>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="96%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (4) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Mr.&#160;Lapping is sole managing member of Jakal Investments,
    LLC, a family trust of Mr.&#160;Lapping. Mr.&#160;Lapping is the
    sole managing member of our Sponsor and has sole voting and
    dispositive power over the Sponsor and as a result he may be
    deemed to be the beneficial owner of any shares owned by the
    Sponsor. Jakal Investments LLC, through its ownership interest
    in the Sponsor may be deemed the beneficial owner of 80,870
    Common Shares. Mr.&#160;Lapping disclaims beneficial ownership
    of any shares in which he does not have a pecuniary interest.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

    which he does not have a pecuniary interest.</TD>

    dispositive power over 57th Street Partners LLC. This amount
    includes Common Shares beneficially owned by 57th Street
    Partners LLC through its ownership of the Sponsor.
    Messrs.&#160;Levitt and Berger disclaim beneficial ownership of
    any shares in which they do not have a pecuniary interest. The
    address of Messrs.&#160;Levitt and Berger are
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">c/o&#160;Stone</FONT>
    Tower Capital, 152&#160;West 57th Street, 35th Floor,
    New&#160;York, NY 10019.</TD>

    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (9) </TD>
    <TD></TD>

    Mr.&#160;Gross disclaims beneficial ownership of any shares in
    which he does not have a pecuniary interest.
    Mr.&#160;Gross&#146; address is 500 Park Avenue, New York, NY
    10022.</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (10) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Does not reflect up to 150,000 Common Shares which may be
    forfeited by 57th Street GAC Holdings LLC in the event certain
    financial and stock price targets are met following the
    consummation of the Transaction. Any such partial (or complete)
    forfeiture shall be apportioned among the members of 57th Street
    GAC Holdings LLC, pro rata, based on their beneficial ownership.
    Please see &#147;The Business Combination Agreement&#160;&#151;
    Consideration to be Paid&#148; for more information regarding
    the financial and stock price targets and forfeiture of Common
    Shares by 57th Street GAC Holdings LLC.</TD>

    and the Certificate of Designation, the 390,000&#160;shares of
    57th Street Series&#160;A Preferred Stock issued to the Members
    in connection with the consummation of the Transaction (and not
    held in escrow as Contingency Consideration) will be cancelled.
    Does not reflect: (i)&#160;up to 440,000&#160;shares of 57th
    Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock issuable in
    connection with certain financial and stock price targets, none
    of which is convertible into common stock; provided, however,
    upon the conversion of New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable
    Units into common stock by any such Member, the shares of 57th
    Street Series&#160;A Voting Preferred Stock owned by such Member
    are cancelled at a ratio of 1:10 and (ii)&#160;up to 4,400,000
    New Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units which may be earned
    by the Members, pro rata, based upon their beneficial ownership
    of the target prior to the Transaction, if  </TD>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Voting
    Interests of Existing 57th Street Stockholders Following the
    Transaction</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The table below outlines the effect of the various scenarios
    regarding the percentage of our voting interests that will be
    held by our stockholders who hold Common Shares purchased as
    part of the units in our IPO (the &#147;Public Shares&#148;),
    our founders and Sponsor, the Members and others after the
    Transaction is completed. The following is based on our issued
    and outstanding Common Shares as of February&#160;17, 2011.
    Depending on the scenario, the current holders of our common
    stock (including holders of Common Shares and our founders and
    Sponsor) will hold from 13.19% to 73.50% of our voting interests
    after the Transaction. The table assumes that no holders of
    Common Shares tender their stock and provides for the tender of
    all of the Insider Warrants.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE border="0" width="100%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 8pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

<TD nowrap align="right" valign="bottom">
    X
</TD>
<TD nowrap align="left" valign="bottom">
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 13%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD align="right" valign="top">
    (1) </TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    Assumes: (i)&#160;immediate conversion of 3,900,000 New Crumbs
    Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units issued to the Members and not
    subject to financial and stock price targets into 3,900,000
    Common Shares and (ii)&#160;cancellation of the
    390,000&#160;shares of 57th Street Series&#160;A Voting
    Preferred Stock issued to the Members and no part of the
    Contingency Consideration (pursuant to the Agreement and the
    Certificate of Designation, such 57th Street Series&#160;A
    Voting Preferred Stock shares are cancellable upon conversion of
    the New&#160;Crumbs Class&#160;B Exchangeable Units into common
    stock at a ratio of 1:10).</TD>
</TR>

    <TD align="right" valign="top">

    Sponsor, 200,000 Insider Warrants owned by the underwriters of
    the IPO and 5,456,300 Warrants owned by our public
    warrantholders.</TD>

    to be Paid.&#148;</TD>

    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">

    such shares are subject to performance and stock price targets.
    If such financial and stock price targets are not met (or
    partially met) at the end of the contingency consideration
    period, such unearned shares will be cancelled. The 150,000
    contingent Common Shares are only included in the &#147;57th
    Street Founders and Sponsor&#148; column of this table in those
    boxes marked with an &#147;X&#148;.</TD>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    136
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<A name='W81625123'>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">CERTAIN
    RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED TRANSACTIONS</FONT></B>
</DIV>
</A>
<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">57<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: top">TH</SUP>

    Street</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Founders
    Shares and Insider Warrants</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On October&#160;30, 2009, 57th Street issued to the Sponsor
    638,889 restricted shares (the &#147;Insider Shares&#148;), for
    an aggregate amount of $25,000 in cash. The purchase price for
    each share was approximately $0.039. The Sponsor agreed that
    these shares will not be sold or transferred until one year
    following consummation of a business transaction, subject to
    certain limited exceptions. On May&#160;28, 2010, our Sponsor
    forfeited 32,633 of these shares in connection with the
    underwriters&#146; partial exercise of the over-allotment option.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On May&#160;25, 2010, we issued to our Sponsor warrants (the
    &#147;Insider Warrants&#148;) to purchase up to
    3,500,000&#160;shares for $1,750,000. We also issued to the
    underwriters of the IPO, 200,000 Insider Warrants for $100,000.
    The Insider Warrants are identical to the Warrants sold in the
    IPO, except that if held by the original holders or their
    permitted assigns, they (i)&#160;may be exercised for cash or on
    a cashless basis; (ii)&#160;are not subject to being called for
    redemption; and (iii)&#160;with respect to Insider Warrants held
    by the underwriters and beneficially owned by Mark Klein as a
    result of being a member of the Sponsor, will expire
    May&#160;19, 2015, or earlier upon redemption or liquidation.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Mark Klein, our chairman, chief executive officer and president,
    is an associated person of Ladenburg Thalmann&#160;&#038; Co., a
    member of FINRA and one of the underwriters of our IPO, and a
    member of our Sponsor. As a member of our Sponsor, Mark Klein is
    deemed a beneficial owner of 149,357 of our initial shares and
    1,020,000 of the Insider Warrants purchased by our Sponsor. As a
    result of Mark Klein&#146;s relationship with Ladenburg
    Thalmann&#160;&#038; Co., the 149,357 initial shares and the
    1,020,000 Insider Warrants beneficially owned by Mark Klein,
    together with the Insider Warrants purchased by the underwriters
    and the shares underlying all such Insider Warrants, have been
    deemed to be underwriting compensation by FINRA and are
    therefore subject to a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">360-day</FONT>
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">lock-up</FONT>
    pursuant to Rule&#160;5110(g)(1) of the FINRA Conduct Rules.
    Mark Klein and the underwriters have agreed not to sell,
    transfer, assign, pledge or hypothecate the initial shares, the
    Insider Warrants or the common stock underlying the Insider
    Warrants beneficially owned by them, and further agreed that
    such initial shares, Insider Warrants or common stock underlying
    such Insider Warrants will not be the subject of any hedging,
    short sale, derivative, put or call transaction that would
    result in the effective economic disposition of such Securities
    to any person other than as permitted under
    Section&#160;5110(g)(2) of the FINRA Conduct Rules.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Pursuant to the terms of the Business Combination Agreement, our
    Sponsor has agreed to tender all 3,500,000 of its Insider
    Warrants in the Offer at a Warrant Purchase Price of $1.00 per
    Warrant.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Escrow</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On May&#160;19, 2010, our Sponsor placed the Insider Shares and
    the Insider Warrants into an escrow account maintained by
    Continental Stock Transfer&#160;&#038; Trust&#160;Company,
    acting as escrow agent. Other than transfers made to permitted
    transferees who agree in writing to be bound to the transfer
    restrictions, agree to vote in favor of our initial business
    transaction in the event we seek stockholder approval in
    connection with our initial business transaction and waive any
    rights to participate in any liquidation distribution if we fail
    to consummate an initial business transaction, the initial
    shares will not be released from escrow until one year following
    our business transaction, unless we were to consummate a
    transaction after the consummation of the initial business
    transaction that results in all of our stockholders having the
    right to exchange their public shares for cash, securities or
    other property. Pursuant to the Escrow Agreement, the Insider
    Warrants will not be released from escrow until 30&#160;days
    following the consummation of our initial business transaction.
    Permitted transferees means: immediate family members of the
    holder and trusts established by the holder for estate planning
    purposes; and affiliates of a holder.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Pursuant to the Business Combination Agreement, the Sponsor will
    execute a letter agreement under terms and conditions reasonably
    acceptable to the parties and Sponsor whereby, at the Effective
    Time, 150,000 Common Shares issued to the Sponsor (the
    &#147;Founder Restricted Stock&#148;), shall remain in escrow
    pursuant to
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    137
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    the Escrow Agreement. Such shares will be released from escrow
    to the Sponsor as follows (subject to adjustment):
    (a)&#160;50,000&#160;shares in the event the First Stock Target
    has been achieved;
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    (b)&#160;50,000&#160;shares in the event the Second Stock Target
    has been achieved;
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT>
    (c)&#160;50,000&#160;shares in the event the Third Stock Target
    has been achieved;
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">and/or</FONT> to
    the extent the foregoing Stock Targets have not been fully
    achieved, 75,000&#160;shares of Founder Restricted Stock in the
    event the 2013 EBITDA Target has been achieved and/ or to the
    extent the foregoing Stock Targets have not been fully achieved,
    75,000&#160;shares of Founder Restricted Stock in the event the
    2014 EBITDA Target has been achieved; and/ or any remaining
    Founder Restricted Stock not otherwise released in the event the
    2015 EBITDA Target has been achieved.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Indemnification</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In order to protect the amounts held in the Trust&#160;Account,
    Mark D. Klein, our chairman, chief executive officer and
    president, and Paul D. Lapping, our chief financial officer,
    treasurer, secretary and director, have agreed to indemnify 57th
    Street for all claims of creditors, to the extent that we fail
    to obtain waivers from vendors, service providers and
    prospective target business to the extent necessary to ensure
    that the amounts in the Trust&#160;Account available for
    distribution to our stockholders do not fall below $9.98 per
    share, except as to any claims by a third party who executed a
    waiver of any and all rights to seek access to the
    Trust&#160;Account and except as to any claims under our
    indemnity of the underwriters in the IPO against certain
    liabilities, including liabilities under the Securities Act of
    1933, as amended. In the event that an executed waiver is deemed
    to be unenforceable against a third party, Messrs.&#160;Klein
    and Lapping will not be responsible to the extent of any
    liability for such third party claims. In the event that the
    proceeds in the Trust&#160;Account are reduced below $9.98 per
    share in the event we redeem 100% of our shares of common stock
    issued to the public for a per share pro rata portion of the
    Trust&#160;Account, or upon our liquation and Messrs.&#160;Klein
    and Lapping assert that they are unable to satisfy their
    obligations or that they have no indemnification obligations
    related to a particular claim, our independent directors, if
    any, would determine whether to take legal action against
    Messrs.&#160;Klein and Lapping to enforce their indemnification
    obligations. While we currently expect that our independent
    directors would take legal action on our behalf against
    Messrs.&#160;Klein and Lapping to enforce their indemnification
    obligations to us, it is possible that our independent directors
    in exercising their business judgment may choose not to do so in
    any particular instance. Accordingly, we cannot assure you that
    due to claims of creditors the actual value of the (i)&#160;per
    share redemption price or (ii)&#160;per share liquidation price
    less than $9.98 per share.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Registration
    Rights</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Pursuant to a registration rights agreement entered into
    concurrent with the closing of our IPO, our Sponsor, the
    underwriters of our IPO as it relates to the Insider Warrants,
    and their permitted transferees will be entitled to registration
    rights. Such holders will be entitled to demand registration
    rights and certain &#147;piggy-back&#148; registration rights
    with respect to the initial shares and the Insider Warrants and
    the shares underlying the Insider Warrants, commencing, in the
    case of the initial shares, one year after the consummation of
    our initial business transaction and commencing, in the case of
    the Insider Warrants and the respective common stock underlying
    the Insider Warrants, 30&#160;days after the consummation of our
    initial business transaction. Pursuant to the Business
    Combination Agreement, the Sponsor will tender all of its
    Insider Warrants pursuant to the Offer.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Loans
    to 57th Street</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We issued a $10,000 unsecured promissory note to our Sponsor on
    November&#160;10, 2009. The note was repaid paid from the
    proceeds of our IPO in May 2010.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Expenses</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    From January 1 through June&#160;30, 2010, an officer of 57th
    Street paid vendor bills on behalf of 57th Street in the
    aggregate amount of $5,051, which was due on demand without
    interest. The balance was repaid from the proceeds of our IPO in
    May 2010.
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    138
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We will reimburse our officers and directors for any reasonable
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">out-of-pocket</FONT>
    business expenses incurred by them in connection with certain
    activities on our behalf such as identifying and investigating
    possible target businesses and business transactions.
    Reimbursable
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">out-of-pocket</FONT>
    expenses incurred by our officers and directors will not be
    repaid out of proceeds held in the Trust&#160;Account until
    these proceeds are released to us upon the completion of a
    business transaction, provided there are sufficient funds
    available for reimbursement after such consummation. The
    financial interest of such persons could influence their
    motivation in selecting a target business and thus, there may be
    a conflict of interest when determining whether a particular
    business transaction is in our public stockholders&#146; best
    interest.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Lack
    of Compensation, Fees</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Other than reimbursable
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">out-of-pocket</FONT>
    expenses payable to our officers and directors, in no event will
    any of our Sponsor, officers, advisors or directors, or any of
    our or their respective affiliates be paid any finder&#146;s
    fee, consulting fee or any other form of compensation, including
    the issuance of any of our Securities, prior to, or for any
    services they render, in order to effectuate the consummation of
    a business transaction. Furthermore, we have adopted a policy
    prohibiting our Sponsor, officers, directors and members of our
    advisory board or any of our or their affiliates from receiving
    any finder&#146;s fee or other compensation from a target
    company for services rendered in connection with a business
    transaction
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Crumbs</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Financial
    and Accounting Services</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    On January&#160;2, 2008, Accounting Strategies Group, LLC,
    (&#147;ASG&#148;), a limited liability company in which John D.
    Ireland, a Member and its Chief Financial Officer, is a member
    began providing certain financial and accounting services to
    Crumbs. In 2009 and 2010 Crumbs paid ASG $37,040 and $44,250,
    respectively, for services rendered. On January&#160;19, 2011
    Crumbs entered into an engagement letter with ASG to provide tax
    preparation and bookkeeping services at ASG&#146;s customary
    rates charged to non-affiliated third parties.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Banking
    Arrangements</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    During 2008 Crumbs entered into certain banking agreements with
    Southeastern Bank and Magnolia Bluff, Inc. (&#147;Magnolia
    Bluff&#148;), a Georgia corporation owned by Edwin Lewis, a
    member and Chairman of the Board of Managers of Crumbs and sole
    member of EHL Holdings, LLC (EHL Holdings&#148;), a member of
    Crumbs. Crumbs, Southeastern Bank and Magnolia Bluff entered
    into the following agreements in 2008 (i)&#160;Bank Loan
    Agreement, dated June&#160;16, 2008, for $500,000,
    (ii)&#160;related Promissory Note, dated May&#160;30, 2008, for
    $500,000, and (iii)&#160;related Guaranty, dated August&#160;14,
    2008, for $500,000 (collectively, the &#147;2008 Banking
    Agreements&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The 2008 Banking Agreements were superseded by the following
    banking agreements among Crumbs, Southeastern Bank and Magnolia
    Bluff entered into on June&#160;11, 2009, (i)&#160;a Bank Loan
    Agreement for $575,000, (ii)&#160;related Promissory Note for
    $575,000 and (iii)&#160;related Guaranty for $575,000
    (collectively the &#147;2009 Banking Agreements&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    The 2009 Banking Agreements were superseded by the following
    banking agreements among Crumbs, Southeastern Bank and Magnolia
    Bluff, Inc., entered into on October&#160;25, 2010, (i)&#160;a
    Bank Loan Agreement for $575,000, (ii)&#160;related Promissory
    Note for $575,000, and (iii)&#160;related Guaranty for $575,000
    (collectively the &#147;2010 Banking Agreements,&#148; and
    together with the 2008 Banking Agreements and the 2009 Banking
    Agreements, collectively the &#147;Banking Agreements&#148;).
    The Banking Agreements have been utilized for the purposes of
    issuing letters of credit required by the landlords of certain
    of Crumbs&#146; stores. Pursuant to the Banking Agreements,
    Southeastern Bank issued Irrevocable Standby Letters of Credit
    for the following stores: New York&#160;&#151; Broadway in the
    amount of $50,000; California&#160;&#151; Calabasas in the
    amount of $9,645.33; New&#160;York&#160;&#151; Columbus in the
    amount of $42,917.00; New York&#160;&#151; Garment Center in the
    amount of $43,749.99; California&#160;&#151; Americana in the
    amount of $10,416.67; New York&#160;&#151; Grand Central in the
    amount of $29,287.50; Connecticut&#160;&#151; Greenwich in the
    amount of $18,750.00; New Jersey&#160;&#151; Hoboken in the
    amount of $24,300.00; New York &#151;&#160;Huntington in the
    amount of $15,750.00; New York&#160;&#151; Lexington in the
    amount
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Paragraph Pagebreak -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    139
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    of $17,500.00; Chicago&#160;&#151; Madison in the amount of
    $45,600.00; California&#160;&#151; Malibu in the amount of
    $27,000.00; New Jersey&#160;&#151; Ridgewood in the amount of
    $7,500.00; New York -Third Avenue in the amount of $62,500.00;
    New York&#160;&#151; Union Square in the amount of $41,925.00;
    New York&#160;&#151; Upper East Side in the amount of
    $28,144.00; New Jersey&#160;&#151; Westfield in the amount of
    $9,440.00; and Connecticut -Westport in the amount of
    $15,000.00. The Banking Agreements have been secured by land
    fronting Highway 251 and I-95 in McIntosh Co., Georgia owned by
    Magnolia Bluff. As of December&#160;31, 2008, 2009 and 2010,
    respectively, no amounts were outstanding under the promissory
    notes related to the Banking Agreements and there were no
    amounts drawn on any letters of credit related to the Banking
    Agreements. Mr.&#160;Lewis, Magnolia Bluff and EHL Holdings have
    not received any consideration for the security provided in
    connection with the Banking Agreements.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 2%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <B><I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Leases</FONT></I></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Beginning January&#160;1, 2009 until December&#160;31, 2010,
    Crumbs leased office space in Preston, Maryland from Preston
    Strategies, LLC (&#147;Preston Strategies&#148;), a limited
    liability company of which John D. Ireland, a member of Crumbs
    and its Chief Financial Officer, is a member. During 2009,
    Crumbs paid rent of approximately $11,910. During 2010, Crumbs
    paid rent to Preston Strategies of approximately $16,960. On
    January&#160;1, 2011, Crumbs entered into a commercial lease
    agreement with Preston Strategies whereby Crumbs agreed to lease
    the same office space at a rate of $1,725 per month through
    December&#160;31, 2011.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Crumbs, Inc., a New York corporation and a Member assumed the
    lease obligations of certain entities which were merged with and
    into Crumbs, Inc. for the certain Crumbs stores pursuant to the
    following leases: (i)&#160;Lease, dated May&#160;23, 2007, by
    and between SunVic Properties, Inc. and Crumbs Beverly Hills,
    Inc. for the Beverly Hills location in respect of which rent was
    paid in the amount of approximately $97,706 in 2009 and
    approximately $100,637 in 2010 and which has remaining lease
    obligations of approximately $711,538 as of December&#160;31,
    2010; (ii)&#160;Standard Retail/Multi-Tenant Lease&#160;&#151;
    Net, dated January&#160;17, 2008, by and between Larchmont
    Properties, Ltd. and Crumbs Larchmont, Inc., and Lease Addendum,
    dated January&#160;4, 2008, by and between Larchmont Properties,
    Ltd. and Crumbs, Inc., d/b/a Crumbs Beverly Hills for the
    Larchmont location in respect of which rent was paid in the
    amount of approximately $61,350 in 2009 and approximately
    $63,195 in 2010 and which has remaining lease obligations of
    approximately $518,295 as of December&#160;31, 2010;
    (iii)&#160;Retail Lease Agreement, dated October&#160;6, 2005,
    by and between 1114 TrizecHahn-Swig, L.L.C. and Crumbs
    42nd&#160;Street, Inc. for the 42nd&#160;Street location in
    respect of which rent was paid in the amount of approximately
    $38,792 in 2009 and approximately $38,500 in 2010 and which has
    remaining lease obligations of approximately $201,163 as of
    December&#160;31, 2010; (iv)&#160;Agreement of Lease, dated
    August&#160;16, 2006, by and between Uniway Partners, L.P. and
    Crumbs Downtown, Inc. for the Downtown location in respect of
    which rent was paid in the amount of approximately $125,001 in
    2009 and approximately $127,707 in 2010 and which has remaining
    lease obligations of approximately $844,220 as of
    December&#160;31, 2010; and (v)&#160;Commencement/Expiration
    Agreement, dated June&#160;22, 2007, by and between RBNB 67 Wall
    Street Owner LLC and Crumbs Wall Street Inc. for the Wall Street
    location in respect of which rent was paid in the amount of
    approximately $90,431 in 2009 and approximately $85,656 in 2010
    and which has remaining lease obligations of approximately
    $527,710 as of December&#160;31, 2010. Crumbs, Inc. is owned by
    Jason Bauer, a member of Crumbs, a member of Crumbs&#146; board
    of managers and its Chief Executive Officer, Mia Bauer, a Crumbs
    member and its Chief Creative Officer and Victor Bauer, a Crumbs
    member. Crumbs, Inc. and its owners have not received any
    consideration for assuming the lease obligations above.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Jason Bauer, a member of Crumbs, a member of Crumbs&#146; board
    of managers and its Chief Executive Officer, personally
    guarantees the following leases (and corresponding financial
    obligations): (i)&#160;Agreement of Lease, dated June&#160;18,
    2010, between One Ten West Fortieth Associates and Crumbs
    Holdings, LLC for the corporate headquarters in respect of which
    rent was paid in the amount of approximately $83,2856 in 2009
    and approximately $89,327 in 2010 and which has remaining lease
    obligations of approximately $1,944,513 as of December&#160;31,
    2010; (ii)&#160;Lease, dated May&#160;23, 2007, by and between
    SunVic Properties, Inc. and Crumbs Beverly Hills, Inc. for the
    Beverly Hills location in respect of which rent was paid in the
    amount of approximately $97,706 in 2009 and approximately
    $100,637 in 2010 and which has remaining lease obligations of
    approximately $711,538 as of December&#160;31, 2010;
    (iii)&#160;Standard Retail/Multi-Tenant Lease&#160;&#151;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    57th Street is subject to the informational filing requirements
    of the Exchange Act, and, accordingly, is obligated to file
    reports, statements and other information with the SEC relating
    to its business, financial condition and other matters.
    Information, as of particular dates, concerning its directors
    and officers, their remuneration, the principal holders of our
    securities and any material interest of these persons in
    transactions with us is required to be disclosed in reports and
    proxy statements distributed to our stockholders and filed with
    the SEC. We also have filed an Issuer Tender Offer Statement on
    Schedule&#160;TO (the &#147;Schedule&#160;TO&#148;) with the SEC
    that includes additional information relating to the Offer.
    These reports, statements and other information can be inspected
    and copied at the public reference facilities maintained by the
    SEC, at 100&#160;F&#160;Street, N.E., Washington,&#160;D.C.
    20549. Copies of this material may also be obtained by mail,
    upon payment of the SEC&#146;s customary charges, from the
    Public Reference Section of the SEC at 100&#160;F&#160;Street,
    N.E., Washington,&#160;D.C. 20549. You may obtain information
    about the Public Reference Room by calling the SEC for more
    information at
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">1-800-SEC-0330.</FONT>
    The SEC also maintains a website on the Internet at
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">http://www.sec.gov</FONT>
    that contains reports, proxy and information statements and
    other information regarding registrants that file electronically
    with the SEC, including the Schedule&#160;TO and the documents
    incorporated therein by reference.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    143
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 87%; margin-left: 6%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak End -->

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <IMG src="w81625w8162504.gif" alt="Rothstein Kass Logo">
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: transparent">

    <FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Report of
    Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
    </FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    To the Members of
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Crumbs Holdings LLC
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of
    Crumbs Holdings LLC and Subsidiaries, (the &#147;Company&#148;)
    as of December&#160;31, 2010 and 2009, and the related
    consolidated statements of operations, changes in members&#146;
    equity and cash flows for each of the two years in the period
    ended December&#160;31, 2010. These consolidated financial
    statements are the responsibility of the Company&#146;s
    management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these
    consolidated financial statements based on our audits.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the
    Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those
    standards require that we plan and perform the audits to obtain
    reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are
    free of material misstatement. The Company is not required to
    have, nor were we engaged to perform an audit of its internal
    control over financial reporting. Our audits included
    consideration of internal control over financial reporting as a
    basis for designing audit procedures that are appropriate in the
    circumstances, but not for the purpose of expressing an opinion
    on the effectiveness of the Company&#146;s internal control over
    financial reporting. Accordingly, we express no such opinion. An
    audit also includes examining, on a test basis, evidence
    supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial
    statements, assessing the accounting principles used and
    significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating
    the overall financial statement presentation. We believe that
    our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 4%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    In our opinion, the consolidated financial statements referred
    to above present fairly, in all material respects, the financial
    position of Crumbs Holdings LLC and Subsidiaries as of
    December&#160;31, 2010 and 2009, and the results of their
    operations and their cash flows for each of the two years in the
    period ended December&#160;31, 2010, in conformity with
    accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of
    America.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 24pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    /s/&#160;Rothstein, Kass&#160;&#038; Company,&#160;P.C.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    Roseland, New Jersey
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    February&#160;11, 2011
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="right" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <IMG src="w81625w8162505.gif" alt="AGN Logo">
</DIV>
<!-- XBRL Pagebreak Begin -->

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <BR>
    F-1
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

    F-5
